title: Accountant (part-time, work from home)
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY**

Park Avenue Partners acquires and improves mobile home parks nationwide to expand the supply of affordable housing. We need a dynamic Accountant to join our growing team! Under the direction of the Founder, this person will be responsible for general accounting including financial statement preparation, overseeing our bookkeeper’s work (your direct report), month-end close procedures, bank reconciliations and other accounting needs as they arise. The Accountant will also distribute our financial reports to our lenders, perform basic financial analysis, and manage quarterly profit distributions to our investors. The ideal candidate understands the day-to-day accounting activities necessary to support a business. You work part-time / flex-time around your other commitments. You report to me, and we build this thing together.

**WHO I AM**

I’m a family man and an entrepreneur. I’ve been in the real estate business since 2007. I started with my own money and bought my first property. I now syndicate deals and have cumulatively raised over $45mm from more than 200 investors and acquired 41 MHPs (half of which we’ve sold). Along the way, I started the industry’s first podcast, experienced some very funny situations with tenants and bureaucrats, and have grown to become one of America’s 50 largest owners of mobile home parks.

**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING**

* Maintain financial records for approximately two dozen properties and two funds on monthly basis in Xero
* Review our bookkeeper’s work to insure financial transactions are recorded accurately. Our bookkeeper is your direct report
* Complete month-end reconciliations and prepare the financial statement reports for the business
* Maintain commercial mortgage statements and their reconciliations to the financials on a monthly basis for our properties
* Work in conjunction with outside Consulting and Tax teams (Plante Moran) to ensure proper accounting treatment is being applied
* Insure annual tax payments are made on time

**Compensation and Benefits**

* Part time / flex time
* Work from home
* Base Salary – DOE
* Paid time off
* Fun, supportive environment

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s or Associates Degree in Accounting or related field
* Minimum of 2 years of accounting experience
* Knowledge of Excel
* Working knowledge of financial statements and debits and credits
* Attention to detail
* Willingness to be both teacher and student as needed
* Team player
* Ability to multi-task
* Familiarity with InvestNext or similar investor portal a plus. Willingness to learn is a must

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Experience:

* Accounting: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Accountant
description:
Points of Light mobilizes millions of people to take action that is changing the world. Through 145 affiliates across 39 countries, and in partnership with thousands of nonprofits and businesses, Points of Light engages 3.7 million volunteers in 16.7 million hours of service each year. We bring the power of people to bear where it’s needed most. For more information, visit pointsoflight.org.

**Reports to:** Controller

**Department:** Finance

**Location:** Atlanta, GA – While Points of Light has embraced remote working, this position requires the applicant to work in the Atlanta office as needed; typically, 1 to 2 days a week.

**Position Summary**: Points of Light is seeking an accountant, who will plan, organize and execute the accounts payable/receivable and other related functions of the organization. This position ensures the accuracy of the accounts payable/receivable process and compliance with Points of Light’s policies and procedures. The accountant serves as the primary point of contact with our affiliates and vendors and will develop a comprehensive understanding of the organization’s financial responsibilities.

**Position Functions and Responsibilities include:**

* Maintain invoice processing system and prioritize vendor and affiliate payments.
* Develop and document accounting policies and procedures for accounts payable/receivable and internal controls affecting the accounting team.
* Perform all month-end close responsibilities, including balance sheet and income statement journal entries for POL departments.
* Communicate and interact collegiately with internal constituents, vendors and affiliates.
* Process payments – check, ACH, international wires.
* Assist with various projects such as process improvement activities and training of finance policies and systems.
* Oversee credit card issuance, training, processing, reconciliation, and receipting.
* Manage travel expenses and related systems.
* Handle 1099 processing and issuance.
* Help with cash management and analysis.
* Assist with annual audit by creating compliant documentation and support for financial statements and internal controls.
* Partner with other members of the finance team and assist with monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue forecasts and analysis.
* Support other departments to explain/resolve revenue- related questions/issues, proposals and projects.

**Core Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Speed, with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Excellent memory for programs, transactions, vendors, and constituents.
* Ability to interact professionally with a wide range of people.
* Responsive, positive, “can do” attitude.
* Quick learner, self-starter and adaptable.
* Strong research and analytic skills; propose solutions to problems and answers to questions.
* Ability to find opportunities to improve systems, processes, and documentation.
* Heightened awareness of cybersecurity risks to proprietary data and daily commitment to zero loss prevention.
* The highest ethical personal standards as befits someone with access to confidential employee and private donor data.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum 3-4 years of experience in accounting, undergraduate accounting degree preferred; nonprofit experience a plus.
* Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (advanced Excel), Sharepoint, and Concur or similar A/P and expense reporting applications.
* Excellent written and oral communication, organizational and analytical skills.
* Ability to work independently to identify and resolve problems, while producing timely results.
* Blackbaud (ERP) experience a plus, also Sage Intaact, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar cloud-based ERP systems.

**Culture and Values:** Points of Light has a 30-year history that it seeks to honor, while looking toward the future as an innovative thought leader in the social sector. We have a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Our organization values innovation, dedication, teamwork and respectfulness. We enjoy thinking big, but also working hard to deliver our best work. Our team is solution-oriented, looking for someone who is always ready to deliver on ways to solve challenges, both internally and with external partners.

**What We Offer:** Competitive compensation and excellent benefits including a robust PTO program: 18 days of PTO, 13 holidays, and 1 floating holiday; plus, we are closed December 25 to January 1 for winter break. Medical, dental and vision benefits offered, free life insurance, along with long-term and short-term disability, a 403b program with employer match, and 1 day of volunteer time off per month.

***Points of Light is an Equal Opportunity Employer Committed to an Inclusive Workplace.***

title: Staff Accountant
description:
**Staff Accountant**


The Staff Accountant position is responsible for maintaining Financial Statements in accordance with GAAP Accounting and providing internal and external reporting functions to aid Management in making timely decisions.


**Essential Functions**

* Monthly closing of Financial Statements including A/P Accruals and other General Journal entries
* Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly, & Annual internal and external reporting duties
* Monthly Bank Reconciliations
* Run Daily/Weekly/Monthly Sales, Loan Collateral Assignments, Writeoffs, & Account Buyback processes.
* Create/update reports as assigned by the Accounting Manager
* Assist with Year End Audit and Bank Exams
* Limited Internal Audit duties
* Monitor Daily, Weekly, Monthly Cash Collections for Securitizations & Lines of Credit
* Other duties as assigned by the Accounting Managers


**Required Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting required
* 2 Years Related Accounting Experience required
* 2 years public accounting experience preferred
* Certified Public Account preferred
* Proficient in the utilization of Microsoft Office Suite
* Excellent reasoning and critical thinking skills
* Attention to detail and accuracy required
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills required


**Physical Demands**


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, stand, walk, visualize, talk, hear, and handle or touch objects or controls. The employee may occasionally lift, push, or pull up to 20 pounds.


This position is an office-based position where you must be able to sit for long periods of time. The employee will be working on a computer 90% of the time.

title: Revenue Accountant/Analyst
description:
About Us:

Emerus is the nation’s first and largest operator of small-format hospitals, also known as community or neighborhood hospitals. Emerus’ leading national health system partners include Allegheny Health Network, Ascension, Baptist Health System, Baylor, Scott & White Health, Dignity Health St. Rose Dominican, The Hospitals of Providence, INTEGRIS and MultiCare. Our state-of-the-art hospitals are fully accredited and provide highly individualized care. From the moment a patient walks through the door, a team of exceptional medical professionals takes charge, treating patients with speed, compassion and expertise. Emerus’ distinctive level of care earned the Guardian of Excellence Award for Superior Patient Experience in six of the past seven years. More information is available at www.emerus.com.
Position Overview:

This position will be an integral part of the month end close process, with monthly close duties surrounding revenue recognition for patient service revenue, assisting with the monthly revenue package, ensuring proper revenue recognition in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and revenue analysis. This role consists of applying company policies & procedures related to all aspects of revenue and accounts receivable. This role also provides support to the Revenue Recognition team for internal and external reporting needs.  

The successful candidate enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, has a financial accounting foundation, understanding of internal control systems and processes, excellent communication and listening skills, and possesses intellectual curiosity.
Essential Job Functions:
* Maintains, monitors and ensures the consistency of underlying data utilized in revenue and AR valuation models.
* Updates and reconciles monthly the asset and liability accounts pertaining to accounts receivable.
* Responsible for general ledger functions related to patients accounts receivable and revenue, such as GL journal entry preparation, statistical journal entry preparation, account analysis and reconciliations.
* Provides support to the Revenue Recognition team to prepare AR schedules during the month-end close process by collecting data from various systems, ensuring accuracy and integrity. Ensures timely preparation of patient accounts receivable and revenue reporting schedules, including the monthly close, performance reports, and various cash collection reports.
* Understand internal and external drivers impacting key performance metrics.
* Understand the methodology used in the valuation of revenue and AR and related upstream and downstream impacts.
* Provides support to the Revenue Recognition team through financial data gathering and analysis related to internal and external reporting needs.


Other Job Functions:
* Participate in cross-functional business projects and perform ad hoc analysis as required.
* Perform additional duties as assigned.


Basic Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related degree, required.
* 1-3 years’ experience in accounting or financial reporting
* Working knowledge of financial statements and analytics, required
* Good general business knowledge and exposure to a variety of business situations
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook), required.
* Strong personal initiative to produce quality materials within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several tasks.
* Position requires fluency in English, written and oral communication.
* Must have the following additional qualifications:
	+ Excellent communication and listening skills.
	+ High attention to detail
	+ Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workflow and meet deadlines.
	+ Strong interpersonal and collaborative skills
	+ Be able to work from home independently while maintaining communication with the team.

title: Staff Accountant
description:
At WorkRamp, we believe that the best companies grow through learning. That’s why hundreds of market leaders such as Box, Lattice, and Outreach choose the Learning Cloud to power employee and customer learning. Boost employee performance, grow revenue, and scale customer success with WorkRamp. Learn more by visiting workramp.com. **Why WorkRamp?*** Recently raised a $40M Series C led by Salesforce Ventures, Slack Fund, and Susa Ventures
* Named Among Best Workplaces in Software by Inc. Magazine for 2022
* G2’s 2023 Best Software Awards: Top 50 Best Products for Mid-Market
* G2’s 2023 Best Software Awards: Top 100 Highest Satisfaction Products
* Ranked #873 on this year’s Inc. Magazine 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America
* Made #9 on Fortune’s Best Workplaces for Women™ list 2022
* Mogul’s Top 100 Companies with Inclusive Benefits in 2022
* Great Place to Work® Certified August 2022-August 2023
* Named a 2022 & 2023 Y Combinator Top Company
* #1 Top-Rated LMS by The Motley Fool
* JMP Securities Hot 100 Startups: The best privately held software companies 2022
* Otta’s ROCKET LIST 2022: 100 of the fastest-growing companies to accelerate your career
* #1 on Inc's 2021 Best Workplaces List for Startups
* Fortune's Best Places to Work in the Bay Area 2021
* Top 100 fastest-growing SaaS companies of 2020 by SaaS Mag

 **What’s the opportunity?**
We are looking to bring on a staff account to our finance and business operations team! The staff accountant will be responsible for owning and improving our foundational accounting processes. We’re looking for an analytical, collaborative and process-driven accountant who is motivated by continuous improvement. You will report to the VP of Finance and Business Operations.  

 **What will I be doing?*** Own end to end process of deal close out and invoicing
* Ensure all invoice data is accurately tracked in our systems to ensure accurate revenue recognition
* Own collections process and drive quick collection of invoices
* Own all revenue reporting, ensuring the business can pull metrics across all types of revenue (product, segment, price etc.)
* Prepare account reconciliations, journal entries, and supporting documentation as part of the close processes
* Perform contract reviews to verify subscription contracts have been accurately recorded
* Help with month-end, quarter-end and year-end audits to ensure accurate financial reporting
* Consolidate financial data from various IT systems into the GL and perform detailed reconciliations to ensure accuracy and completion of data transfers
* Collaborate effectively with outsources accounting firm
* Drive process improvement projects to streamline and automate manual workflows

  

**What skills do I need?*** 2-5 years of relevant accounting experience
* Solid grasp of US GAAP and accounting for SaaS businesses
* Experience preparing the month end close package


- Proficient in Microsoft Excel- Exceptional attention to detail* Excellent time management and organizational skills
* Prior experience with Quickbooks, Bill.com and Expensify
* Experience collecting overdue invoices
* Ability to define, implement and manage the creation of new processes
* Proven ability to meet tight deadlines, multi-task, change direction quickly and prioritize workload
* Startup experience preferred

 **Perks**
-Fully Remote - Work from anywhere in the US* Flexible Time Off & 13 company-wide holidays
* Equity with annual refreshes
* Full healthcare coverage
* 100% paid short-term & long-term disability insurance, plus life insurance
* Stipend for remote work setup & DeskPass account
* Annual stipend for professional development
* 401K
* Mental Health and Wellness Resources including a free subscription to Calm Premium & access to 2 Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)
* Employee Resource Groups (Mental Health, Womxn of WorkRamp, WorkRamp Asian/Pacific Islander, WorkRamp Afro-xxx/African-American/Black, LGBTQties, Juntos Latinx, WorkRamp Pride)
* Access to Well-Being Benefits including: One Medical, Gympass, Carrot, & Headspace

 **This role is fully remote and can be based anywhere in the US.****At this time, WorkRamp does not sponsor work visas.**  

$80,000 - $90,000 a year**Compensation**
WorkRamp is committed to fair, equitable, and transparent compensation. Final compensation will be determined by a variety of factors such as your relevant work experience, education, certifications, and skills. This role's on-target earnings (OTE) range is $80,000- $90,000 annually.  

Employees at WorkRamp may be eligible for additional compensation, such as a bonus, commission, and stock grants. Employees may also be eligible for a wide range of other benefits, including medical, retirement, financial, wellness, time off, employee perks, and others. The full comp package designated for this role can be discussed with your Recruiter during the interview process. **Not sure if you should apply?**
Find yourself checking some of these boxes but doubting whether you should apply? At WorkRamp, we are committed to creating the most talented, diverse workforce, supporting a growth mindset for our team members through all stages of their careers. We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply. If you meet some of the requirements and you share our values, we’d love to hear from you! As part of our ongoing commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace, we’re invested in building teams with a wide variety of backgrounds, identities, and experiences.

title: Accountant
description:
Ozmo is seeking an experienced Accountant to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for performing all month and year-end closing procedures, developing and maintaining financial reports, oversee the maintenance and review of the general ledger, and assist with the annual financial audit. You will assist the Director of Finance in developing the annual operating budget and provide input to ensure that Ozmo achieves important financial goals and milestones.


The Accountant will be at the forefront of shaping the company's financial landscape, offering a unique opportunity for impactful contributions, high exposure to critical financial processes, and an engaging work culture that values expertise and innovation. This role offers the ability to get creative with cutting-edge technology, lead department OKRs aimed at improving company processes and transparency, utilize your expertise to ensure financial precision, and foster collaboration and continuous improvement through departmental sprint and quarterly planning processes


As a growing SaaS technology company, Ozmo’s focus is on solving tech support at scale. We build best-in-class software products that are used around the world to improve the lives of tens of millions of people each year by making technology more accessible. Ozmonauts are motivated to continuously improve and love to learn. We pride ourselves in doing exceptional work that delivers real value by transforming the way people think about technology.

**What you will do:**

* Consistently assess accounting operations to identify areas of improvement and automation.
* Prepare accurate and timely financial reports in accordance with U.S. GAAP, ASC606 regulation, and company policy
* Enter timely and accurate data in the general ledger system.
* Perform periodic general ledger account reconciliations.
* Maintain the company’s accounting system and ensure the accuracy of its data.
* Work directly with all levels of personnel to obtain and maintain proper transaction support.
* Be the lead accounting contact for all A/P & A/R communications.
* Oversee all A/P responsibilities, including corporate card accounts, and complete annual 1099 distribution and reporting.
* Ensure reimbursement requests comply with company policy and IRS guidelines.
* Oversee all A/R billing and collection efforts according to contracts and company policy.
* Complete the weekly update of the cash forecasting model.
* Manage fixed assets and coordinate the bi-annual review and disposal process.
* Responsible for ensuring the company’s compliance with sales & use tax and maintaining Nexus tracking and records.
* Implement and test the company’s internal controls.
* Collaborate in the accounting department sprint and quarterly OKR planning cycles.
* Assist with the annual financial audit.
* Other duties as assigned by leadership

**What you bring to this role:**

* Full-cycle accounting and reporting experience
* Knowledge of U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and ASC606
* 5+ years of experience in a progressively similar role
* Bachelor of Science in accounting or related field
* Google Suite experience
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Exposure to Agile methodologies
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Ability to work collaboratively on cross-departmental initiatives
* A fresh, fun, collaborative personality to contribute to our culture!

**Perks of being an Ozmonaut:**

* Medical, vision, dental and life insurance along with short and long-term disability.
* Paid time off (PTO) that grows the longer you're with Ozmo as well as paid holidays.
* 401k to save for retirement with employer matching.
* Paid maternity and bonding leave for new parents.
* Paid pawternity leave when you bring a new pet into your life.
* One-month sabbatical after you have been with Ozmo for five years.

**Pay Range:** $80,000 - $100,000  

  

This position is fully remote. Applicants must be based in the continental US.


Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. Ozmo does not sponsor employment visas.


Ozmo participates in the E-verify program.


Ozmo is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Ozmo is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
**It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!**

*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*

* Job Purpose/Summary-- 4-6 years’ experience in general accounting role in a middle-market organization. Broad knowledge of general accounting activities including month-end close; accruals and reserves; prepaids and fixed assets as well as general ledger maintenance activities. Solid experience with payroll accounting processes and account reconciliations as well as financial reporting development and deliverables. Experienced in utilizing Netsuite or similar ERP system and experience in UKG or similar HR system. Ability to collaborate and deliver accurate and timely information in a fast-paced remote work environment.

**Duties and responsibilities**

**Responsibilities include:**

General Accounting:

* Maintain general ledgers and other financial records
* Perform monthly accruals and journal adjustments as required
* Produce timely and accurate reconciliations and financial reporting
* Maintain policies and procedures while promoting effective internal controls
* Provide supporting documentation for various audits
* Partner with other departments/customers/vendors as needed
* Actively participate in department process improvement initiatives
* Provide support to other departments and accounting management team.
* Accounts Receivable:
* Review and process client invoices
* Manage client deposits and process related payment applications
* Add and maintain new client setup in the accounting system
* Review and generate applicable aging reports for management

**Minimum Qualifications**

***Education***

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting (required)  
CPA certification, eligibility or equivalent (preferred)

***Experience/Training***

* Proven knowledge of accounting / ERP systems; Experience with Workday Financial Management is preferred.
* Comfortable with productivity tools such as Microsoft Office Suite.

* Familiarity with MS Access or another relational database
* Experience with data imports and exports
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Strong mathematical and analytical skills
* Proven ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously

**Working Conditions**

Work is performed in a professional office environment with no unusual hazards. There may be some travel with overnight stays. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

**Physical Requirements**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.

**Other Duties**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching

* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* MUST HAVE •• Proven knowledge of accounting / ERP systems; Experience with Workday Financial Management is preferred.
* Comfortable with productivity tools such as Microsoft Office Suite.
* Functional knowledge of MS Excel software including use of pivots, advanced logic, and lookup formulas.
* • 4-6 years’ experience in general accounting role in a middle-market organization. Broad knowledge of general accounting activities including month-end close; accruals and reserves; prepaids and fixed assets as well as general ledger maintenance activities. title: Senior Accountant
description:
**Pay Philosophy**
The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.

 **Description**The Reinsurance Operations Team provides accurate and insightful financial, analytical and claims information. We support the internal and external core reinsurance programs by providing a foundation to establish and enhance strategic product offerings through traditional and alternative reinsurance solutions for our global customers. Additionally, the Reinsurance Team safeguards company assets through proactive identification and management of reinsurance recoverables, the second largest Liberty Mutual asset. As a Senior Accountant, you will conduct complex assignments involving maintaining ledger accounts and developing financial statements and reports.

 ***Note: This is a Hybrid opportunity with compensation dependent on candidate’s geographic location, overall experience, and skill level.***

 **Responsibilities:**

* Prepare complex financial reports utilizing a broad knowledge of accounting policies and procedures.
* Prepare and/or input general ledger entries by utilizing set procedures and various accounting systems.
* Oversees functions of the monthly, quarterly and annual book close cycles, monitoring timely completion and escalating issues for resolution.
* Proactively review financial statments for assigned treaties (statement of income, balance sheet, and statement of cash flows).
* Research complex accounting treatment and policies by utilizing available technology and other resources.
* Research and resolve complex reconciling issues and discrepancies; take corrective measures to prevent.
* Direct interaction with internal and external stakeholders.
* Prepare analysis and be prepared to provide explanations for unusual and/or inconsistent trends.
* Suggest process improvement initiatives and provide solutions to enhance current processes.
* Accurately and efficiently performs accounting activities of increasing complexity.
* Creates increasingly complex financial statement schedules, audit support schedules and other reports in a timely manner.
* Performs detailed review of other team members` schedules.
* Researches and applies accounting policy to business issues that arise.
* Establishes, documents and performs internal control procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting.
* Understands how data flows through the financial systems to the accounting function in order to identify issues and take action to address them.
* Continually assesses the business value and efficiency of the work performed, making suggestions for improvements and collaborating with others in implementing them.
* Leads or actively participates in increasingly complex department projects and continuous improvement activities.
* Fosters the development of teammates by sharing expertise and experience through training or reviewing their work.
* Provides feedback on performance.

**Qualifications*** Bachelor`s degree (Accounting or Finance) and a minimum of 3 years of accounting or finance experience preferred
* Must demonstrate attention to detail in a fast-paced work environment and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously to achieve results
* Must be able to communicate effectively with teammates and others, leading meetings and interacting with increasingly higher levels of management to gather information and effectively present results/recommendations
* Advanced knowledge of Excel and Microsoft Word is preferred

**About Us**
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.  

  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New Graduates as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits  

  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

title: Senior Accountant 100% Remote
description:
Are you looking for:

* Flexible hours,
* 100% remote work,
* Friendly colleagues, and
* Endless learning opportunities?

Would you be great at:

* Building relationships with clients, and
* Supervising bookkeeping for small businesses?
* If so, this opportunity is for you!

BooksTime is looking for an experienced accountant to join us as a Senior Accountant. You’ll oversee bookkeeping services for a set of clients. You will NOT be required to do:

* Any tax work
* Basic bookkeeping (you supervise the bookkeepers)
* Management\\*

(\\*However, management opportunities are available for those interested.)

**Who We Are:**

BooksTime is an ambitious, innovative accounting & bookkeeping startup founded in 2016 with operations in 5 countries. For more information, check out our website: bookstime.com.

**What You'll Do:**

**As a Senior Accountant, you'll:**

Set up services for new clients: You'll talk with them, understand their needs, and coordinate a team of international bookkeepers to get services up and running. Your role is to be a high-level accounting resource to the bookkeepers, help manage communication with the client (including managing their expectations), and generally build a personal relationship with the client.

Supervise ongoing services: After the set-up is done, you’ll supervise and support the bookkeepers as needed for the same clients.

As a growing, evolving startup, there will also be opportunities to take on different or more specialized roles. For example, if you’re interested, there could be versions of this role that involve:

* Only new service set-up
* Only ongoing supervision
* Industry-specific specialization
* Management
* And much more

**We're Looking for Someone Who Is:**

Experienced. Our ideal candidate has handled the accounting for multiple companies (either in-house in an accounting/bookkeeping firm). If you had any of the following titles, it’s a good sign: Controller, Finance Manager, Full Charge Bookkeeper, Director of Accounting, VP of Finance, CFO, Senior Accountant, etc. Management experience is valuable but not required. Candidates should also have hands-on experience working directly in QuickBooks.

Knowledgeable. Most folks in this role have degrees in accounting (or similar) though this isn't strictly required. Being a CPA and/or ProAdvisor would be a plus, and common for this role, but these aren’t required either.

Highly organized. This role is a high-speed juggling act. You need to juggle multiple clients with different services and coordinate the work of a diverse team of bookkeepers. This requires exceptional organizational and time management skills.

Great at building strong relationships. A key part of the role is to establish a personal rapport with the clients. More than just an accountant, the goal in this position is to become a trusted advisor. This takes a friendly, positive “people person”.

A great communicator. As the face of BooksTime to the client, you should have excellent professional communication skills. You will need to be perfectly fluent in English (written and spoken).

Tech-savvy. You will need to be adept with computers and good at figuring out new systems and tools. Excel expertise is preferred. QuickBooks Online or Desktop experience is required. Experience with other accounting software, such as Xero or NetSuite, is not required but would be helpful.

An adaptable, fast learner. Every client is unique in terms of personality, needs, software, etc., so each new client is a learning experience. We need someone who feels very comfortable diving in and figuring things out. If you are happiest maintaining a well-established process that someone else designed, this is NOT the ideal role for you. If you love looking for creative solutions to new problems all the time, you could be a perfect fit!

(Note: for more experienced candidates, a management-track version of this role is available. For less experienced candidates, a less senior version of the role is available. Please feel free to inquire for details about these other roles.)

**Why Join BooksTime:**

Friendly and Supportive Work Environment. We may be biased, but our team is the best! We promote a healthy work/life balance and everyone on the team is friendly, supportive and always willing to lend a helping hand. Internal, anonymous surveys are sent frequently, and the results are consistently extremely positive. People love working here!

Make History. We have big plans to disrupt the accounting and bookkeeping industry – and we’re off to a great start.

Work That Matters. Your work is critical to the success of our clients, and of BooksTime.

Flexible Hours. Part time and full time options available. Either way, most of your hours can be very flexible. (We just need a certain amount of availability during business hours, including at least some hours between approx. 9-11am Eastern on at least 3 weekdays. More details below.)

Growth Opportunities. BooksTime is expanding and we will need more people in management roles very soon. It’s likely that someone in this role could be promoted in a number of months, based on interest and ability.

Work That Stays Fresh. You’ll have 10-30 clients, including all sorts of industries, software, service needs, etc. That means ample opportunities to learn new things. Plus, given the pace of change at our growing startup, we can pretty much guarantee that you will never be bored.

Constant Improvement. One of our core values at BooksTime is Constant Improvement. We’re always pushing to do better, from thinking of new ways to "wow" our clients to discovering opportunities to make internal processes more efficient. Our goal is to become the #1 bookkeeping firm in the country -- and our relentless focus on Constant Improvement is what will get us there. We can't wait to hear your ideas about how we can do better. If you're looking for a role that gives you unlimited opportunities to make an impact -- you've found it!

**Other Details:**

Hours: Your clients are all over the US. Some of your colleagues work in European time zones. To ensure overlap with clients and colleagues, you should at least be available approx. 9-11am Eastern at least 3 weekdays. The rest of your hours can be more flexible.

Full-Time/Part-Time: Both options available. Full-time preferred. For part-time, a minimum of 30 hours/week is required.

Salary Range: Negotiable based on education and experience.

**Benefits include:**

* Health (QSEHRA reimbursement plan)
* Retirement
* Paid time off (starting at 20 days for full time employees)
* Tech reimbursements
* (Depending on part-time/full-time status and other factors, there may be eligibility restrictions in some cases.)

COVID-19 considerations: This position is, and always will be, 100% remote.

**DEI Statement**

*BooksTimers come from every background and walk of life. We don't just talk about DEI in the abstract. BooksTimers come from every background and walk of life. We don't just talk about DEI in the abstract. Our actual team (at every level) is a cross-section of the world. We're building a team that's inclusive of the planet's best accountants and entrepreneurs across categories of race, ethnicity, national origin, native language, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, and more.*

*BooksTime is a majority woman-owned business (a rarity in accounting). Approx. 90% of BooksTimers are women. One of the original reasons BooksTime exists is that founder Sonya Livshits wanted to create opportunities for women across the globe to gain financial independence through flexible careers in accounting.*

*Most importantly, at our core, we're deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can feel comfortable bringing their full self to work. Our goal is to be the #1 place accountants want to work -- including and especially people with disabilities, BIPOC, LGBTQIA people, immigrants, parents and caregivers, and people re-entering the workforce after some time away.*

For more information, check out our website: bookstime.com.

**IMPORTANT:** For your application to be considered, you MUST submit a cover letter and resume. Please provide a very brief cover letter that answers the following 2 questions: (1) What would your ideal job look like? (2) What do you think will be most challenging about this role based on the description?

NOTE: Submitting the skills assessments is preferred. The candidates who submit these will be reviewed first.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $35.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 32 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* How many years of managing multiple clients experience do you have?
* How many years of Quickbooks experience do you have?
* This is a reminder that a cover letter is required for your application to be considered. Have you included a cover letter?

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Aurora Sustainable Lands (Aurora, fka Bluesource Sustainable Forests Company), was formed in the fall of 2021 as a joint venture of the global Investment firm Oak Hill Advisors and Anew Climate, LLC, the largest marketer and originator of carbon and environmental credits in North America. Aurora's mission is to purchase and more sustainably manage high value forestland. In total, Aurora now owns and manages some 1.8 million acres of forestland spread over 17 U.S. Eastern states, and the firm is now one of the 10 largest forestland owners in the U.S.



The Senior Accountant will report to the Controller and will be an integral part of a small accounting and finance team.


**Primary Responsibilities and Competencies:**


* Assist in preparation of financial statements and supporting schedules under USGAAP Operating Company guidelines on a quarterly basis
* Actively participate in annual audit and tax preparation process
* Prepare journal entries and account reconciliations
* Analyze cash and other general ledger accounts
* Contribute to the onboarding and development of new or amended accounting systems, programs, policies, and procedures with a special focus on finding efficiencies and controls
* Assist in preparation and analysis of budgets and cash flow forecasts
* Support for AR AP as a preparer and/or reviewer
* Participate in Ad-Hoc projects as needed


**Required Education, Experience and Certification:**


* Bachelor's degree in accounting or similar. CPA or advanced degree preferred
* At least 5 years of relevant work experience, with timberland and/or carbon development experience a plus
* Solid working knowledge of USGAAP and Financial Statements
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel
* Experience with Intacct accounting software a plus
* Excellent time-management skills with the ability to be responsive, attentive, creative, friendly and speak in a professional manner
* Effectively communicate while exhibiting the ability to engage in active listening and communicate complex technical accounting information in layman's terms
* Experience working with a remote team
* Ability to research complex accounting issues and self-solve with the guidance of manager
* Willingness to be a team player by doing functions that may be outside of normal accounting/job responsibilities

title: Staff Accountant
description:
**This position offers extensive workplace flexibility - candidates have no mandatory in-office time required and are able to work remote living within the Pacific Standard Time Zone or Mountain Standard Time Zone.**  

  

**About the Company:**  

Charter Impact empowers mission-driven organizations to achieve their goals through personalized support in finance, operations, and business management. We accomplish this through enthusiastic collaboration within our team and with our clients to support their communities. We are growing on a national scale and are continuously seeking qualified candidates to join us. Ideal candidates will be highly motivated professionals who are committed to supporting the team in an environment of growth and change.  

**Position Summary:*** The Staff Accountant is responsible for managing daily accounting tasks for multiple complex clients, primarily nonprofits in the charter school industry, and works alongside a fast-paced team of accounting professionals.
* Responsibilities include performing general ledger account and bank reconciliation with the assistance of the Accounting Associates, preparing journal entries and financial statements, completing all grant compliance reports and budget-to-actual variance reports, client interaction, and resolving client, governmental agency, and auditor inquiries.
* This position reports to an Accounting Manager and provides ongoing career growth opportunities with experiential training and development.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:****Cash Maintenance:*** Review weekly bank reconciliations and cash position reports prepared by the Accounting Associate.
* Record all inter-company transactions and transfers.
* Review other work performed by the Accounting Associate.
* Assist with entry and review of other monthly transactions as needed.
* Communicate with management regarding cash flow issues and potential courses of action.

**Month-End Closing:*** Perform month-end close procedures and prepare financial statements as needed.
* Enter and post journal entries.
* Record appropriate monthly accruals.
* Reconcile inter-company accounts.
* Perform analysis and provide reasoning for variances.
* Prepare various schedules for balance sheet support including amortization and fixed asset schedules.

**Other Financial Reporting:*** Complete all grant compliance reports and budget-to-actual variance reports for assigned clients.

**Client Interaction:*** Perform new client onboarding.
* Provide new client training.
* Be a resource for clients when questions arise regarding banking, reporting, and other accounting matters.
* Resolve inquiries from clients, governmental agencies, and auditors.

**Other Duties:*** Assist in special projects and year-end audit schedule preparation.
* Be a resource for Accounting Associates on industry best practices.
* Demonstrate the ability to problem-solve.
* Perform other duties as assigned by the Accounting Manager.

**QUALIFICATIONS:*** Generally, any combination of education that would provide the required knowledge and skills for successful performance would qualify.


A typical method of demonstrating these requirements would be:**EDUCATION:*** Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related field.
* A Master’s degree is a plus.

**LICENSE:*** A CPA license or CPA eligibility is a plus.

**EXPERIENCE:*** At least 2 years of experience preparing financial statements (full close).

**KNOWLEDGE OF:*** Purposes, methods, and practices of financial and accounting record-keeping.
* Basic accrual accounting principles and procedures.
* Advanced Microsoft Excel skills and Intermediate Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook) skills.
* Proper and effective use of English grammar and communication skills (oral and written).

**Candidates must also have the ability to:*** Maintain, encourage, and participate in a close and highly collaborative team environment with clients and Charter Impact staff.
* Communicate in a clear and professional manner at all times.
* Adapt quickly to change.
* Learn the appropriate rules, regulations, and technical procedures specifically related to processing payments for non-profit organizations and charter schools.
* Understand and carry out directions in an independent manner.
* Perform arithmetic calculations accurately and rapidly.
* Prepare a variety of accurate financial reports and summaries.
* Identify and correct errors in mathematical computations and financial documents.

**Experience with the following is a plus:*** Abila Non-Profit Accounting (formerly Sage MIP).

**TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** (with or without accommodation as needed to perform essential job functions).* Read numbers, reports, and documents on computer terminals.
* Use the telephone and other communication devices.
* Lift up to 20 pounds (Light).
* Prolonged standing, some bending, stooping, and stretching.

**TYPICAL MENTAL DEMANDS:**
Ability to give, receive, and analyze information, formulate work plans, prepare written materials, and articulate goals and action plans.  

**WORKING CONDITIONS:*** Work indoors in a standard office environment.
* Occasionally work outside of normal workdays and office hours to meet deadlines.
* Travel may be required for professional development events and to client locations.
* Is required to directly communicate and interact with clients, parents, students, and the public.

**COMPENSATION:*** Salary is commensurate with experience.
* A standard benefits package is included.

**TO APPLY:*** Submit both cover letter, resume, and salary requirements.
* Be sure to include an explanation as to why you are interested in the position.

**About Us**
Charter Impact empowers mission-driven organizations to achieve their goals through personalized support in finance, operations, and business management. We accomplish this through enthusiastic collaboration within our team and with our clients to support their communities.  

  

  

**About Charter Impact:**  

  

Charter Impact empowers mission-driven organizations to achieve their goals through personalized support in finance, operations and business management. We accomplish this through enthusiastic collaboration within our team and with our clients to support their communities.

title: Non-Profit Corporate Accountant
description:
**STEAMpark Corporate Accountant**

**Job Description**

We are a non-profit organization looking for an exceptionally organized and detail-oriented Accountant to join our team. In this part-time role, you will help our entire team more effectively manage our programs through accurate and timely maintenance of the company’s financial systems, reports, and data.

The ideal candidate must have at least 5 years’ experience in the non-profit accounting field (specifically using QuickBooks Non-Profit Software), significant computer experience with Google suite of products, payroll bookkeeping and tax reporting experience. Excellent communication skills a plus, particularly if the candidate has experience working with donors, sponsors, vendors and customers. Tax and Payroll Accounting experience is a plus. Must have the ability to devote 15 hours a week but can be on a flexible schedule.

Job Type: Part-time, flexible schedule

Work Location: Remote

Pay: $30 per hour at an estimate of 15 hrs per week

**Responsibilities include:**

* Record transactions via bank feeds or manual entry
* Perform general ledger, bank account and credit card reconciliations
* Handle Accounts Receivable (A/R –from Individual Clients & Companies), invoice clients and collections
* Handle Accounts Payable (A/P – Vendors & Bills)
* Process employee reimbursements, receipts, and expense reports
* Assist with financial needs for Fundraising events
* Prepare weekly cash forecast
* Generate monthly financial reports
* Update donation information for Development staff/Executive Director
* Calculate pay and issue payments to employees - Contractor and W-2 payments
* Work with Gusto to prepare end of year W-2s and 1099s
* Maintain state corporate filings (Charity Registration, bi-annual Charities Gaming License, Annual Report)
* Coordinate communication/requests with Insurance Companies
* Assist in the preparation of the Annual Budget
* Coordinate with auditors for annual audit and Federal and State tax filings
* Assist in preparation of financial reports for quarterly Board meetings

**Desired Skills and Experience:**

* 5 years or more experience as a professional non-profit Accountant
* Bachelor’s degree in an accounting field or related discipline required
* Strong writing skills- able to communicate effectively with all members of STEAMpark as needed via email.
* Able to translate complicated concepts into clear and compelling visual narratives (infographics, icons, charts, data visualization).
* Highly proficient in Quickbooks Online.
* Extremely organized, self-starter, able to work independently as a virtual employee.
* Ability to devote approximately 15 hours a week to this position

Interested candidates, please send your resume to elaine.melia@steampark.orgfor consideration.

Pay: $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 20 per week

* 5 years

* Monday to Friday

title: Senior Accountant
description:
**Job description**

**Property Accountant**

Are you an extremely detailed, independent, fast-paced, structured person who enjoys small projects and a busy yet predictable environment? Are you looking for a rewarding, long-term career? We are looking for a Senior Property Accountant to join our team and start a new exciting chapter!

**Our Company**

Brick and Vine is a multifamily investment and property management firm actively acquiring and managing workforce housing properties in multiple markets throughout the United States. We are a tech-focused, socially conscious team backed by a $1bn AUM Bay Area investment manager and led by veterans of multiple industries including single-family rentals, venture-backed fintech startups, private equity and institutional fixed-income investment. Our mission is to add value to real estate and create solid investor returns, while offering affordable workforce housing to an underserved segment of residents. People are our ultimate asset and we are looking for those who are technically savvy, exceptional in their area of expertise, and seeking an opportunity to build, not just contribute to an organization.

**Job Description**

The Senior Property Accountant is responsible for the day-to-day accounting functions required to produce monthly GAAP financial statements for properties owned and managed. Accuracy and timeliness in the completion of the workload, strong communication skills, good work ethic, analytical thinking are required to succeed in this position. This job is fully remote so the candidate MUST be able to organize themselves and deliverables per required timeline and coordinate with a small accounting and larger property management team via Teams.

The Accounting team is very small, so the candidate must be a self-starter who can wear multiple hats and must be able to take full responsibility for all workflows assigned.

**Primary Responsibilities And Objectives**

* Lead monthly bank reconciliations
* Answer questions for all business lines about AP, Financial statements and some operational metrics
* Prepare and processing payroll
* Record monthly adjusting and accrual entries
* Update fixed asset system for additions and disposals and record monthly depreciation/amortization
* Monitor cash balances
* Prepare monthly financial statement analysis according to GAAP with variance reporting
* Compile monthly financial statement package with required supporting documentation
* Distribute financials
* Assist in the annual audit and tax return preparation
* Assist in annual budget preparation
* Record tenant receipts against monthly charges
* Process monthly tenant billings and other miscellaneous billbacks
* Monitor tenant accounts for overages/shortages and past due amounts
* Send monthly invoices/statements to tenants
* Review lease entries in Entrata
* Process payable invoices: review, code and acquire proper approvals
* Manage weekly cash flow spreadsheet to determine which payables are to be paid
* Record electronic payments
* Assist with loan draws and monitoring capital expenditures

**Key Qualifications, Skills And Education**

* Bachelor's degree in accounting required
* Experience with financial reporting
* 3+ years of experience as a property accountant preferred
* Clear understanding of P&L statements, GLs, budgeting, etc.
* Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including formulas, vlookups, pivot tables, and macros
* Proficiency at Microsoft Office Suite and ability to quickly learn other software applications
* Ability to communicate in a professional manner
* Ability to prioritize, set, and meet deadlines

**Opportunity Highlights:**

* Well capitalized sponsors with ability to rapidly expand portfolio.
* Work with a collaborative, dynamic team of industry professionals with growth potential at all levels.
* Learn from seasoned investors and operators from multiple sectors.
* Access to the best tools and software in the industry.
* Competitive salary and generous benefits

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $70,00.00 - $85,000.00 per year based on experience

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* property management accounting (Required)

License/Certification:

* CPA (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Please explain your experience working remotely, or why you think you are a good candidate for a remote position if you don't have experience?

title: Remote Accountant (Part-Time)
description:
Are you an experienced accounting professional who would love a part-time, work-from-home position allowing you to achieve the optimal work/life balance that you have always dreamed of? Would you enjoy using your accounting expertise to remotely help businesses thrive and support multiple clients without having a draining tax season, all from the comfort of your own home office?



If you're interested in working **part-time**, between **20-30 hours**a week, during traditional daytime business hours (8:00 am – 5:00 pm EST, CST, MST, or PST) and embracing new technology, then we may have the perfect opportunity for you!


**What We Do…**



Since 2004, we have been empowering business owners by taking bookkeeping and operational support functions off their plates allowing them to focus on their core business. Supporting Strategies' experienced professionals use our cutting-edge cloud-based platform, virtual infrastructure, and proven process to deliver a suite of outsourced transactional, full-cycle accounting services.



Supporting Strategies has over 100 offices throughout the U.S. and is continuing to grow rapidly! This momentum has created fantastic opportunities for accountants who thrive on providing exceptional client service while seeking optimal work-life balance as well as the strength of a network community of over 800 employees nationwide.


**What You'll Do…**



The responsibilities associated with this role are organized into areas that are very important to Supporting Strategies as an organization. We have purposely chosen the word "delight" when defining these responsibilities because it appropriately captures how passionate we are about these initiatives, and we naturally hope you will share in our sentiment. Your day-to-day will shift as you grow in the organization and into your role; but you can expect to work directly with clients, discover and implement software, manage and document our internal workflow and provide guidance to your clients.


**Client Delight –** ***Building Great Client Relationships***


* Provide exceptional accounting and operational service to our clients.
* Demonstrate a thorough understanding of professional accounting and bookkeeping practices.
* Support client onboarding process for all assigned client engagements in accordance with defined process.
* Execute, as applicable, processes related to accounts payable and accounts receivable management, bookkeeping entries, closing the books monthly as well as preparing financial reporting and analysis.
* Collaborate with your manager and other Associates on your team to ensure all clients are delighted with our services through timely and effective communication.
* Manage day-to-day relationships with clients while performing within established processes and budget parameters.
* Identify and recommend to your manager areas where Supporting Strategies may be able to provide additional services or tools to drive additional client value and efficiency.


**Team Delight –** ***Creating a Satisfying & Collaborative Virtual Environment***


* Participate in recurring team and one-on-one video check-in meetings to ensure you are aligned for success.
* Confidence in learning and embracing new technology to solve client issues.
* Embrace coaching and feedback provided by your manager and implement changes as needed to help meet team and client goals.


**What You've Done…**


* A minimum of a bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business.
* 5+ years of full-cycle accounting experience (e.g accounts payable, accounts receivable, closing books monthly and preparing financial reporting and analysis).
* 1+ years of transactional accounting experience using QuickBooks or NetSuite
* Experience in a multi-client environment highly preferred.
* Capacity and commitment to work during business hours (8:00 am – 5:00 pm EST, CST, MST, or PST).
* Managed day-to-day relationships with clients while performing within established processes and budget parameters.
* Exhibited a passion for and sense of personal satisfaction in delighting clients and helping businesses succeed.
* Commitment to maintain the highest level of confidentiality while working with client data.

Pay range**Pay Range**


$30—$35 USD
As online scams are rampant, don't fall victim to fraud. Supporting Strategies will never seek payment from you or request personal information from you prior to extending a job offer. Our interview process is always a combination of a phone and video interviews; a job offer will never be extended via online chat.


*Supporting Strategies is deeply committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. A diverse workforce is not just attained but is**built upon a culture of inclusion and belonging. Supporting Strategies is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

title: Bank Accountant
description:
**Company Description**
-----------------------


Square Financial Services (SFS)


Block is one company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment. The blocks that form our foundational teams — People, Finance, Counsel, Hardware, Information Security, Platform Infrastructure Engineering, and more — provide support and guidance at the corporate level. They work across business groups and around the globe, spanning time zones and disciplines to develop inclusive People policies, forecast finances, give legal counsel, safeguard systems, nurture new initiatives, and more. Every challenge creates possibilities, and we need different perspectives to see them all. Bring yours to Block.


Square Financial Services, Inc. (the "Bank" or "SFS") was approved for an industrial bank charter by the Utah Department of Financial Services ("UDFI") and deposit insurance from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation ("FDIC") in March 2020. The Bank opened in March 2021 as a Utah corporation and has since been delivering on Block's mission of economic empowerment by helping small business owners and underserved communities across the United States. SFS is focused on providing lending service to small businesses on a nationwide basis. SFS also offers small business savings accounts and may also seek to raise FDIC insured deposits nationwide.

**Job Description**
-------------------


The SFS Accounting team is looking to hire a Loan Accountant based remotely that will be an integral part of our growing team. This role is responsible for partnering closely with the product and systems teams to ensure that loan activity is appropriately captured and accounted for in our financial statements. The ideal candidate will be highly analytical and able to work in a collaborative and fast-paced environment. We are open to having this role be full-time remote but this role will support our team based in Mountain Time and will be expected to be available during the team's core hours.

  

You will:

* Partner with engineering and product teams to build scalable revenue recognition and reconciliation processes in Oracle and/or other newly developed systems
* Review current loan revenue recognition processes/procedures, and implement process improvements to improve efficiency and timeliness of the close and reporting
* Prepare journal entries, reconciliations and supporting schedules related to SFS.
* Interface with Technical Accounting, Internal Audit and the Company’s independent public accounting firm on technical accounting matters
* Continuously improve business processes, systems, and enhance documentation and controls as part of our SOX compliance efforts
* Work with diverse and cross functional teams, domestically and internationally
* Partner with Block Inc.’s Accounting, Procurement, Finance & Strategy, Tax, Counsel and Treasury teams to ensure the Bank’s operational needs are met
* Support quarterly reviews and annual audits performed by external auditors
* Document product and process flows with various product engineering and financial teams
* Complete special projects as needed
**Qualifications**
------------------


You have:

* Passion for the fintech industry. Strong interest in technology/knowledge of the industry
* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance, CPA a plus
* 5+ year of accounting experience
* Previous role(s) should include internal or external audit, GL accounting, and/or revenue accounting
* Experience in designing SOX controls for financial and operational processes desired
* Experience in creating new reconciliation procedures and new systems implementation desired
* Technical knowledge and practical knowledge of loan accounting
**Additional Information**
--------------------------


Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.  

  

Zone A: USD $83,900 - USD $125,900  

Zone B: USD $78,100 - USD $117,100  

Zone C: USD $71,400 - USD $107,000  

Zone D: USD $63,000 - USD $94,400


To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information.


Full-time employee benefits include the following:

* Healthcare coverage (Medical, Vision and Dental insurance)
* Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending Account
* Retirement Plans including company match
* Employee Stock Purchase Program
* Wellness programs, including access to mental health, 1:1 financial planners, and a monthly wellness allowance
* Paid parental and caregiving leave
* Paid time off (including 12 paid holidays)
* Paid sick leave (1 hour per 26 hours worked (max 80 hours per calendar year to the extent legally permissible) for non-exempt employees and covered by our Flexible Time Off policy for exempt employees)
* Learning and Development resources
* Paid Life insurance, AD&D, and disability benefits


These benefits are further detailed in Block's policies. This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.



We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.


We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. ***Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square?***


Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, assessing candidates in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

  



We’ve noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry, where individuals are sending fake job offer emails. Contact from any of our recruiters or employees will always come from an email address ending with @block.xyz, @squareup.com, @tidal.com, or @afterpay.com, @clearpay.co.uk.


*Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.*


*While there is no specific deadline to apply for this role, on average, U.S. open roles are posted for 70 days before being filled by a successful candidate.*

title: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) - Tax Filing Specialist Maryland
description:
**Location:** Maryland, USA (Remote)

**Company:** Intellectmap

**About Us:**  
Intellectmap is a leading provider of secure, AI-based solutions for businesses of all sizes, revolutionizing the transition from physical properties to digital offices within the AI Metaverse. Our mission is to enable remote work while facilitating seamless collaboration among coworkers and AI avatars. Join us in pioneering the future of real estate.

**Job Description:**  
We are currently seeking a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) with expertise in federal and state tax filing procedures, specifically in the state of Maryland. The ideal candidate will possess in-depth knowledge of tax laws and regulations and be proficient in utilizing the Desktop version of QuickBooks for efficient tax preparation and filing.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and file federal and state tax returns accurately and timely for individuals and businesses in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
* Utilize the Desktop version of QuickBooks for tax preparation and filing.
* Conduct thorough reviews of financial records, ensuring accuracy and completeness of information for tax purposes.
* Provide expert advice and guidance to clients on tax planning strategies and compliance matters.
* Communicate effectively with clients to address inquiries, provide updates on tax filings, and offer valuable insights on tax-related matters.
* Stay abreast of changes in tax laws and regulations and implement necessary adjustments in tax filing processes accordingly.
* Collaborate with other team members to streamline tax preparation processes and enhance overall efficiency.

**Requirements:**

* Certified Public Accountant (CPA) license in good standing.
* Proven experience in preparing and filing federal and state tax returns, with a focus on Maryland tax laws and regulations.
* Proficiency in using the Desktop version of QuickBooks for tax preparation and filing.
* Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.
* Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in handling financial data.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

title: Controller
description:
```Job Overview:```  
As a critical steward of our financial operations in the dynamic networking and telecommunications sector, the Controller holds a pivotal role. This multifaceted position encompasses the generation of regular financial reports, maintenance of a robust accounting infrastructure, vigilant oversight of cash and equity, and the establishment of a comprehensive framework of controls and budgets to proactively manage financial risks, measure performance, and continually improve operations. The Controller bears the responsibility of elevating the precision of our financial outcomes and ensuring unwavering compliance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). Meticulous attention to detail is essential.

```Duties:```

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

Management Responsibilities:

1. Oversee the operations of accounting department and outsourced accounting functions.

2. Formalize a documented system of accounting controls, policies and procedures.

3. Oversee the accounting operations of Attobahn wholly owned subsidiaries and any acquired

entities. Especially control systems, transaction-processing operations, policies, and

procedures.

Transaction Responsibilities

1. Ensure that debts, accounts payable, receivables, and payroll are handled in a timely manner.

2. Ensure all reasonable R&D costs are tracked and seek R&D credits where possible.

3. Ensure monthly bank reconciliations are completed.

4. Maintain the chart of accounts and an orderly accounting filing system.

5. Maintain a system of controls over accounting transactions.

6. Interface with all Vendors on Accounts Payable related matters

7. Maintain timely and accurate synchronization of systems integrated with accounting.

Reporting

1. Recommend benchmarks against which to measure company performance.

2. Issue timely and complete monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

3. Preparation of the corporate annual report and filings with financial and insurance regulators

4. Calculate and issue financial and operating metrics.

5. Create an annual budget, forecasts, calculate and issue financial and operating metrics.

6. Identify variances from the budget & financial policy, report significant issues to management.

7. Provide financial analyses as needed, in particular for capital investments, acquisitions, pricing

decisions, and contract negotiations.

Compliance

1. Coordinate the provision of information to external auditors for the annual audit.

2. Monitor debt levels and compliance with debt and equity covenants

3. Comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings.

```Requirements:```

Qualifications:

Ethics and Integrity:

 Uphold the highest standards of ethics and integrity when handling sensitive financial

information.

Education:

 Required: A bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field. Masters preferred

 Plus: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Certified Management Accountant (CMA)

designation.

Accounting Knowledge:

 Required: In-depth understanding of accounting principles, financial reporting, and GAAP.

 Required: Proficiency in bookkeeping, financial analysis, and financial statement preparation.

 Plus: Experience with R&D Credits, 409a plans, and Private Placement Memorandums

Experience:

 Required: A minimum of 5-10 years in accounting and financial management.

 Required: Proven experience in analyzing financial data and providing actionable insights.

 Plus: Industry-specific experience

Compliance and Regulatory Knowledge:

 Required: In-depth knowledge of tax regulations, payroll regulations, 409a regulation

 Plus: Experience with Franchises and complex product licensing models

Strong Communication Skills:

 Required: Experience explaining financial data to non-financial team members.

 Proficiency in presenting reports to senior management and collaborating with external auditors,

tax professionals, government agencies, and vendors of various sizes and importance.

Software Proficiency:

 Required: Proficiency in using accounting software and financial management tools

 Plus: Net Suite, QuickBooks, Bill.com, Expensify, and Excel.

If you are a highly motivated professional with a strong background in finance and accounting, we invite you to apply for this challenging and rewarding position. We offer competitive compensation packages and opportunities for career growth within our organization.

Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted for further consideration.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $95,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:
