* Disability insurance
* Employee stock purchase plan
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Accountant with DoD Consulting Service Experience
description:
Malasha Technologies Inc. (MTI) is a specialized consulting company for Systems Applications and Products (SAP) enterprise software implementations. MTI’s focus is on implementations of SAP within the Department of Defense (DOD). MTI is looking for an Accountant with DoD Consulting Service Experience to join our team.

**Security Clearance**: Must possess or be eligible for a Secret or higher-level security clearance.

**Objective**: To provide accounting expertise and financial management support for consulting services delivered to the Department of Defense, ensuring compliance with federal regulations and standards.

**Primary Responsibilities**:

· Maintain and manage financial records in accordance with the DoD's financial regulations and guidelines.

· Ensure compliance with the Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS) and other relevant DoD financial management regulations.

· Prepare, examine, and analyze financial reports and statements to ensure accuracy and compliance with established accounting standards and regulations.

· Offer guidance and consultation on financial matters related to DoD projects, including budgeting, financial forecasting, and risk analysis.

· Coordinate with other departments to ensure accurate billing and cost allocation for DoD projects.

· Monitor contract funding and provide timely notifications of any potential overruns or underruns.

· Assist in the preparation and submission of financial statements for annual and special audits.

· Conduct internal audits to ensure financial controls and processes meet DoD standards.

· Stay updated on the latest accounting best practices, federal regulations, and changes in DoD financial management policies.

· Provide financial training and support to team members and other stakeholders as needed.

**Qualifications and Experience**:

· **US Citizenship is required.**

· Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

· Certified Public Accountant (CPA) designation is preferred.

· Minimum of 5 years of accounting experience, with at least 2 years focused on DoD consulting or related DoD financial management roles.

· Knowledge of the Defense Contract Audit Agency (DCAA) requirements and processes.

· Familiarity with the Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA) operations is a plus.

· Proficiency in using accounting software and tools pertinent to the DoD environment.

· Strong understanding of the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and Government Accounting Standards.

**Skills**:

· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

· Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.

· Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

· Familiarity with cybersecurity and data protection standards pertinent to the DoD environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Amylyx was started in 2013 by two Brown University students who had an ambitious goal: to improve the lives of people with neurodegenerative diseases by addressing the root cause. Their research and close collaboration with the ALS community ultimately resulted in our first commercial product, which is now approved in the U.S. and conditionally approved in Canada.



At Amylyx, we're bringing together talented people like you who are guided by our values to be Audacious, Curious, Authentic, Engaging and Accountable in the fight against neurodegenerative diseases like, ALS, Alzheimer's disease, Wolfram Syndrome and others.



Rediscover your purpose and reimagine your career at a company whose founders, mission, and culture are unlike any other in life sciences—in all the best ways.


**Recent milestones include**:


* The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved RELYVRIO™ in September of 2022
* Health Canada approved ALBRIOZA™ with conditions in Canada in June of 2022
* AMX0035 is currently under review with the European Medicines Agency

350 employees globally, with headquarters in Cambridge, MA, US and Amsterdam, the Netherlands * - and growing strong!
**THE ROLE**



Amylyx is seeking a highly motivated professional with public accounting experience in applying accepted accounting principles and procedures to analyze financial information, prepare accurate and timely results and to ensure appropriate accounting control procedures. The position will be a key member of a cross-functional accounting team and will report to the Lead, Accounting. The individual will be responsible for critical accounting areas, corporate and business accruals and ad hoc reporting. Reporting to our Lead, Accounting, this position will have significant interaction with Amylyx business leaders.



Specifically, we are seeking an individual with the traits listed below:


* Motivated self-starter who is detailed, results and process oriented with a focus on effective and efficient improvements.
* Organized individual with the ability to manage multiple priorities while maintaining high performance standards.
* Superior problem solving and analytical skills and ability to work in a highly visible, deadline-oriented position and environment.
* Strong communication and people skills, comfortable working with a cross functional and collaborative team.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Perform and assist with month end and quarter end close accounting tasks including preparation of journal entries ensuring compliance with US GAAP
* Prepare monthly and quarterly account reconciliations to ensure accurate reporting
* Review P&L accounts for proper classifications
* Assist with month end analytical review of actual versus budget and actual versus actual.
* Assist with budgeting and quarterly forecasting
* Month-end closing task management to ensure timely and accurate completion.
* Adherence to global SOX control
* Support end-to-end process for developing, recording and analyzing accruals.
* Assist in the interim and year-end audit process (internal and external)
* Participate in process improvement activities including enhancing current financial processes and suggest areas for improvement
* Supports the Senior Management team with various analyses and ad hoc projects
* Assist in drafting of accounting standard operating procedures for assigned areas


**REQUIREMENTS**


* Bachelor's degree in Accounting
* Minimum of 5 years of public and corporate accounting experience with at least 2 years in public accounting.
* Intermediate level with Microsoft Office Products (advanced Excel preferred)


**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**


* CPA preferred or with a clear path towards finalizing qualifications
* Experience in biotech and pharmaceutical industry a plus
* Experience in publicly traded company a plus
* Experience with NetSuite a plus

  

**To stay connected with us, follow Amylyx Pharmaceuticals on LinkedIn.**

**To return to our website please** **click here****.**



Amylyx is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical matters), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Accommodations are available for candidates who require them in our selection process. If you need an accommodation, please let your Amylyx Talent Acquisition contact know.

title: Accountant (Remote)
description:

title: Financial Reporting Accountant
description:
Symetra has an exciting new opportunity to join us as a **Financial Reporting Accountant!**


**About the role**



The Financial Reporting Accountant participates in the company’s accounting close and reporting cycles. You will perform technical accounting research and documentation, assist with analyzing company results for both internal and external parties, and contribute to projects within the finance department as needed. You bring an understanding of the fundamentals of accounting and reporting requirements with an ability and interest to take on complex tasks.


**Your responsibilities**


* You will participate in the statutory accounting close cycle; preparing journal entries, general ledger reconciliations, and/or reporting files.
* You will be preparing other deliverables, with an increasing understanding of assigned areas and tasks.
* You will research and document accounting issues.
* You will prepare and draft new or updated accounting analyses and policies.

  


**What we offer you**



“If you want to invest in yourself and build a career, this is a great place to work. If you don't want to put in the effort to learn the industry and become a student of the business (it takes real effort!), there are easier places to work.” *Cris H. - AVP Internal Sales, Training and Development*

  



“Symetra is inclusive of all employees regardless of their personal differences.” *Darrell J. - Actuary III*

  



“Symetra values learning. Symetra has so many resources - whether that is the Student of the Business courses, sponsorship of professional certifications, or just individual employees being so willing to teach and answer questions.” *Felicia D. - Financial Reporting Lead Senior Analyst*

  


**Benefits and Perks**

  



We don’t take a “one-size-fits-all” approach when it comes to our employees. Our programs are designed to make your life better both at work and at home.


* Flexible full-time or hybrid telecommuting arrangements
* Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and take advantage of immediate vesting and company matching up to 6%
* Paid time away including vacation and sick time, flex days and ten paid holidays
* Give back to your community and double your impact through our company matching

  



Want more details? Check out our **Symetra Benefits Overview**

  


**Compensation**

  



Salary Range: $62,300- $103,800 plus eligibility for the company annual bonus program.


**Your education, skills and experience**


* BA/BS in Accounting or related field
* 2 years of work-related experience required.
* CPA or CMA is a plus.
* Technical accounting Knowledge: work experience with statutory accounting and reporting required; experience in the insurance industry is a plus.
* Highly organized and skilled at paying attention to details.
* Excellent communication skills
* Intermediate to advanced Excel skills, preferred.


**We empower inclusion.**



At Symetra, we aspire to be the most inclusive insurance company in the country. We’re building a place where every employee feels valued, respected, and has opportunities to contribute. Inclusion is about recognizing our assumptions, considering multiple perspectives, and removing barriers.



We accept and celebrate diverse experiences, identities, and perspectives, because lifting each other up fuels thought and builds a stronger, more innovative company. We invite you to learn more about our efforts **here.**

  


**Creating a world where more people have access to financial freedom.**



Symetra is a national financial services company dedicated to helping people achieve their financial goals and feel confident about the future. In our daily work, we’re guided by the principles of Value, Transparency and Sustainability. This means we provide products and services people need at a competitive price, we communicate clearly and openly so people understand what they’re buying, and we design products—and operate our company—to stand the test of time. We’re committed to showing up for our communities, lifting up our employees, and standing up for diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI). Join our team and help us create a world where more people have access to financial freedom.



For more information about our careers visit: https://symetra.eightfold.ai/careers

  


**Work Authorization**



Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

  



#LI-BW



#REMOTE

title: Staff Accountant
description:
**About Us**

AOC provides full-service accounting and financial consulting services to restaurants and related businesses. We support our clients by maintaining their books and providing them with regular reporting and analytics to best manage their business. AOC’s service is built on hospitality for all restaurants, both large and small.

**About the role**

As a Staff Accountant, you will serve as a primary point of contact between our clients and AOC. In this role, you will be responsible for managing weekly accounting tasks for 8-12 clients, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail while processing accounting packages. You will support our General Ledger Accountants and Client Managers by utilizing critical thinking and exceptional attention to detail. Success in this role requires the ability to manage multiple ongoing client relationships with professionalism and excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

**Specific duties include but are not limited to:**

* Processing accounts payable: inputting invoices, reconciling vendor statements and preparing payments
* Processing payroll: inputting hours, changing rates/withholdings/deductions as instructed
* Inputting and reconciling daily sales
* Entering bank transactions and reconciling bank activity and accounts
* Communicating with clients and co-workers via email, phone and Zoom on a regular basis

**What we are looking for**

* Minimum 3 years of experience in accounting/bookkeeping
* Strong familiarity with QuickBooks, Excel and 10 key touch
* Experience handling full cycle AP with large volume of invoices (500 invoices or more per week)
* Experience processing payroll through systems like ADP & Paychex
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to multitask and meet deadlines; strong time management skills needed
* Ability to liaison with clients as required; provide excellent customer service and build effective working relationships
* A passion for the restaurant business and understanding of how it operates, or a strong desire to learn

**What we offer**

* $55,000 - $65,000 Depending on experience
* Fully remote position with regular office hours (pacific time zone)
* Health insurance
* Paid holidays
* PTO
* 401K
* Employee charitable match program

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Staff Accountant
description:
Job Description

title: Junior Tax Accountant (USA-Remote)
description:
To be considered for this position you must be fully Bilingual in English & Spanish
  
  

**Compensation:** $51K to $60K per Year
  
  

**Job Type:** Full-time (8 hour shift - Monday to Friday)
  
**Location:** Remote (United States except New York and California)
  
  

At GBS Group, our diverse team of multi-disciplinary consultants partners with our clients to ensure they accomplish their business goals. GBS Group prides itself in providing high-quality services through a culture of empathy, understanding, and integrity with our clients. Our client's success is our success. Due to COVID-19, GBS Group took the first step to becoming a remote first company, and since then, we work to make sure that geographical location has minimal or zero impact on our ability to provide exceptional service and experiences to our clients.
  
  

The Junior Tax Accountant position within GBS Group is an integral part of our company. Junior Tax Accountants get to work with experienced Senior Tax Accountants and Consultants to understand our client's business. The Junior Tax Accountant role has the opportunity, as they gain experience, to take on larger more complex assignments and move up to Senior Tax Accountants & Client Manager positions. In the first year, the Junior Tax Accountant will be exposed to many tax concepts involving international regulation.
  
  

Tasks
  
  

**The Junior Tax Accountant will be responsible for:**  

* Analysis of financial information and preparation of financial reports to determine or maintain record of assets, liabilities, profit and loss, tax liability, or other financial activities for clients.
* Prepare 1040, 1040NR, FBAR, 1120, 1120S, 1120F, 1065, and 5471 tax returns and schedules
* Process incoming paperwork such as bank statements and client documentation.
* Facilitating clients to ensure they are complying with federal, state, and local regulatory requirements
* Other responsibilities as assigned.


**Some of your abilities for success are:**  

* Great attention to detail
* Communication and organization skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and high-volume work environment
* Must be comfortable reading, writing, and speaking to clients about tax accounting matters in both English and Spanish.


Requirements
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Taxation – and 1-year experience in USA TAX preparation
* Intermediate Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)
* Basic Knowledge of QuickBooks and Tax Programs
* Fully Bilingual in English & Spanish
* Prior experience preparing tax returns
* Prior experience in coporate/business taxes


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* 1+ years experience working in a CPA or Bookkeeping firm
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
* Intermediate Knowledge of QuickBooks
* Experience working with UltraTax CS
* Interest in perusing CPA or Enroll Agent certification
* Experience in Tax Preparation
* Experience working for a US-based Companies


Benefits
  
  

* 401(k)
* Dental Insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
* Work from home 50% Company Paid Health Insurance (Employee Only)
* Up to 4% Match on 401(k)
* Company Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance
* Company Paid Life Insurance (up to 1xAnnual Salary)
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Eligible for Company Bonus plan


**About the company:**  

At GBS Group we build better businesses. We accomplish this goal by providing integrated business solutions to small and medium businesses. GBS Group has 4 main areas of expertise:
  
  

* Start-up Services
* Financial & Tax Advisory
* Business Consulting
* Human Capital Management


At GBS Group our diverse team of multi-disciplinary consultants partners with our clients to ensure that they are accomplishing their business goals.
  
  

GBS Group prides itself in providing high-quality services through a culture of empathy, understanding, and integrity with our clients. Our client's success is our success.
  
  

GBS Group has offices in Miami, FL; and Houston, TX.
  
  

Our company participates in E-Verify, a U.S. government program that helps businesses verify the identity and employment eligibility of their employees. As a result, all new hires must provide documentation to verify their identity and employment eligibility.

title: Finance Project Accountant
description:
**Project Finance Accountant - US Remote**



The power of three of the world's leading medical communications companies – Nucleus Global, ApotheCom and Ashfield MedComms – and the specialized services and skill sets within MEDiSTRAVA combine to form Inizio Medical. Inizio Medical creates compelling content and engages communities to achieve outcomes that matter.



Our success has led to continued expansion both in the range of services we offer and our global presence. We are now looking for a talented and enthusiastic Project Finance Accountant within Nucleus Global.



The Project Finance Accountant (PFA) works with the Finance Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team to ensure that the company is achieving project profitability and billability through the provision of timely financial information, and the financial management of client projects. The PFA is responsible for managing project financials on a day-to-day basis and assisting the Finance Business Partners with updating the Oracle Fusion system with up-to-date and accurate financial information. The role will involve supporting the FP&A team to ensure that all client financial and internal reporting needs are met.

  


**Education, work experience and skills required**


* Previous accounting or finance experience, coupled with an accounting and finance educational background.
* Strong IT skills with proficiency in Excel and accounting software
* Proactive attitude
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills (with finance and non-finance colleagues) and strong attention to detail skills
* Ability to work on own initiative with a pro-active approach to work
* A strong team player with a collaborative approach to work
* Excellent relationship building skills with employees at all levels
* Proactive attitude to improving processes

  


**Core responsibilities**

* Carries out client invoicing for various clients in line with varying and tight deadlines.
* Updates contracts in the Oracle system, ensuring accuracy to commercial terms.
* Attends internal meetings with FP&A team and client service teams.
* Provides status updates on projects.
* Assists the client services teams with task such as the setup of new customers and verifying rates.
* Assisting with project reconciliations by working with the client services teams
* Ensuring all time movements in the Oracle are carried out for reconciliations in a timely manner.
* Assists in managing client and other invoicing trackers.
* Assists with month end duties, meetings and reporting.
* Provides training to the business on financial compliance and procedures.
* Provides training to the business on the Oracle system.
* Provides the FP&A team with ad hoc assistance.


At Nucleus Global, we are committed to driving a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging where everyone can bring each facet of themselves to work each day. We believe that strength in diversity and inclusivity is a driver of our success.



Nucleus Global is not accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any employee of Nucleus Global and its affiliated companies via email, the Internet or in any form – without a current signed fee agreement for that position (as authorized by the Recruitment Manager) – will be deemed the sole property of Nucleus Global, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired as a result of the referral or through other means.

  

The base salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this position. This range may differ based on your experience and skill set, geographic location, and cost of living considerations. We consider compensation more than just a base salary – that's why we also offer an exceptional range of flexible benefits, personal support and tailored learning and development opportunities all designed to help you realize your full potential both in life and at work.**Compensation**


$50,000—$70,000 USD*Don't meet every job requirement? That's okay! Our company is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role, but your experience doesn't perfectly fit every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this role or others.*

title: Junior Accountant - Entry Level
description:
Come join an organization that has established an outstanding reputation for quality accounting and consulting services. At Flux, our goal is to create and implement solutions that bring clarity and functionality to our clients' daily accounting tasks and in turn, to their financial future. **Flux Accounting** is an innovative firm that is developing a new and exciting way to work with clients by combining the very best technology, customer service, and company culture to make big things happen.

**Flux Accounting** is an accounting firm based in San Diego, CA that specializes in small-to-mid-size businesses. Customer service is always our top priority. We are a fun, approachable firm that shares a huge belief in work-life balance: our employees are never over-worked, and have a responsive, healthy work environment that puts staff happiness before profits. The only thing that is expected in return is a commitment to building that same environment for the clients we serve.

No accounting experience or background? **No problem!** This is an entry level position – we will train you on all the “know-hows” of day-to-day accounting responsibilities. * Onboarding new clients.

title: Property Accountant
description:
**About Sentral**


Sentral is a network of urban residential communities redefining the way people live, travel, and work. Sentral takes the convenience, connection, and comfort of home to new heights-we call it Home+. Designed for the mobile professional, our one-of-a-kind communities offer designer-furnished and unfurnished apartments with flexible lengths of stay in walkable, vibrant neighborhoods. Premium amenities include everything from thoughtful co-working spaces and high-speed Wi-Fi to fitness centers, rooftop pools, homesharing, and more.

  

Whether you stay a year, a night or somewhere in between, Sentral lets you live life on your own terms in the heart of the world's best cities: Atlanta, Austin, Chicago, Denver, Los Angeles, Miami, Nashville, Oakland, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, San Francisco, San Jose, Santa Monica, Scottsdale, and Seattle, with more coming soon.  

  

Our core values reflect our commitment to our employees, as we elevate humanity and make one another better. We strongly believe in continuous personal improvement, career growth and diversity in our work force. With ongoing learning & development offerings, leadership coaching and mentorship programs, we foster an empowered environment rooted in empathy and growth. Our colleagues are curious explorers who never stop learning and who strive for great outcomes.  

  

Learn more about Sentral by visiting www.sentral.com  

(http://www.sentral.com)


**(https://www.daydreamapts.com/)**


**Position Overview and Duties**


Sentral seeks a **Property Accountant** that is responsible for the accounting of a portfolio of properties, with responsibility for the income statement and balance sheet. The ideal candidate has a strong desire to be a part of a unique and rapidly growing company. The right candidate has a growth mindset and an entrepreneurial drive including a high tolerance for uncertainty. To be successful in this role, candidate will be extremely organized, have a roll-up-the-sleeves attitude and a track record of performance. This integral role will be a liaison between the Accounting and Finance Department and Operations Team related to their financial results. The ideal candidate will have a base knowledge of accounting, budgeting, forecasting, accounts payable and receivables.


What You'll Do:


* Responsible for preparing and assisting with review of monthly financial statements for 9+ properties.
* Owns the financial accuracy of the income statement and balance sheet for assigned properties. Be the primary point of contact for Property Managers on the financial statements.
* Works directly with the Property Managers to review financials on a monthly basis. Books accruals and reclasses as a result of those reviews.
* Research and answers questions from Property Managers regarding month-end financials.
* Prepares Balance Sheet Reconciliations for properties, including supporting documentation. Resolves issues and posts reclasses and true-ups as applicable.
* Records expenses in compliance with the company capitalization vs. expense policies.
* Works with third party on the bank reconciliations and provides answers to questions to resolve any open items.
* Ensures correct coding of AP and journal entries which is consistent with company budgets and policies.
* Assist with monthly financial statement analysis according to GAAP with variance reporting.
* Assists with annual external audits as needed.
* Assist in implementing accounting policies and procedures.
  

  

**Skills and Experience**


* Accounting or finance degree, or relevant experience.
* 3+ years Experience in being part of a real estate accounting team.
* REIT experience preferred.
* NetSuite & Yardi experience preferred.
* Experience in implementing and optimizing accounting processes.
* Experience in training property level teams on accounting processes.
* Strong operational, customer service skills.
  

  

**Sentral Benefits**

  

* Healthcare Coverage: We are committed to providing comprehensive healthcare plans (medical, dental, vision, and other benefit options) to our team members and their families.
* Career Development: We offer extensive learning and development opportunities to support growth.
* Paid Time Off: Sentral fosters a flexible work lifestyle by offering generous paid time off to team members.
* Matching 401K: To help you reach your savings goals, we offer a 401(k) plan with a match.

title: Cost Accountant
description:
**Cost Accountant**

**Ethos** **Cannabis-** **Philadelphia, PA**


Website: www.ethoscannabis.com

**Company Overview**


Ethos Cannabis is a multi-state cannabis company with operations in the cultivation, processing and dispensing of cannabis in Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, and Maryland and we are pursuing expansion opportunities. Our goal is to have a clear and compelling consumer-centric vision focused on helping individuals feel and live better through their experiences with cannabis. Our mission is supported by our relationship with Jefferson Health, a leading academic medical center in the U.S., dedicated to collecting and analyzing valuable real-world data and developing educational initiatives with a focus on patient outcomes and quality of life. Jefferson Health is our Academic Clinical Research Center partner for our vertically integrated operations in Pennsylvania.

  

Our principals have significant experience investing in healthcare, consumer products, and regulated markets and have been actively focused on the cannabis industry since 2015. Our leadership at Ethos Cannabis has experience developing and leading successful cannabis operators in the U.S.

  

Job Summary: We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytically skilled Cost Accountant to join our finance team. The Cost Accountant will play a critical role in managing and implementing the costing formulas developed by our contractors, ensuring accurate and timely entries into our ERP software. This role is essential for capturing precise costing data, which is pivotal for our financial analysis and decision-making processes.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Implement and manage the costing formulas developed by our contractors.
* Perform monthly inputs and updates of costing data into our ERP system.
* Ensure accurate allocation of costs to appropriate cost centers and projects.
* Conduct regular audits of cost procedures and data to ensure accuracy.
* Collaborate with various departments to gather necessary data and insights.
* Assist in developing and maintaining internal cost accounting procedures and documentation.
* Provide detailed cost analysis and reporting to support management decisions.
* Participate in monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes.
* Work closely with the finance team to integrate cost accounting data with overall financial analysis and reporting.
* Support the yearly audit process by providing necessary documentation and explanations related to cost accounting.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Education**
-------------

* Bachelor's degree in business administration, finance, or accounting

**Work Experience**
-------------------

* At least 2-3 years of cost accounting experience. Experience in a manufacturing operation preferred.

 **Capabilities and Skills**

* Strong proficiency in ERP systems and MS Office, especially Excel. Experience in Microsoft Dynamics F&O a significant plus.
* Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Strong understanding of cost accounting principles and practices.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

 **Other Requirements**

* This position is based in Philadelphia with options for remote work
* Ability to travel to Ethos operating states when necessary
* Must pass stringent background test requirements
* Minimum of 21 years of age
* Possess valid driver's license or state ID card; authorized to work in the S

**Compensation**
----------------

* This position offers annual salary compensation with additional incentive compensation based on performance.

This position is classified as Exempt and is not entitled to overtime  
* 

  

  

Ethos Cannabis is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in the recruitment, selection, or advancement of employees on the basis of race, sex, color, national origin, creed, age, religion, marital status, disability, political affiliation, or on any other basis prohibited by law.


Employment opportunities shall be provided for applicants with disabilities and reasonable accommodation(s) shall be made to meet the physical or mental limitations of qualified applicants or employees.

title: Accountant
description:
As an Accountant, you will apply your knowledge of GAAP Accounting principle, analytical skills to ensure the integrity of the accounting data for financial reports. We are looking for leaders who are willing to dig deep, learn fast, discover improving opportunities, and provide solutions. If you are a team player with the “can do” attitude and not afraid of exploring opportunities outside of your comfort zone, this is a position for you. It is also important the candidates demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to work in a multi-disciplinary team. This position will report to the Accounting Manager and will work with a team of Sr. Accountant and Sr. Analysts.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Performing all aspects of the accounting closing process, including but not limited to review system generated entries, prepare manual journal entries, and ensure the accuracy of the financial statement.
* Preparing balance sheet account reconciliations.
* Documenting existing, and new accounting policies and procedures.
* Partnering with IT and other cross functional teams to drive necessary SAP system modification/enhancement to improve existing accounting operation as well as establish new processes based on business needs.
* Supporting both internal & external audit activities, including remediation of issues found during audit. • Assisting in accounting compliance activities including but not limited to SOX and Balance Sheet Review.
* Providing in-depth analysis on both P/L and Balance sheet accounts.
* Supporting other ad-hoc analysis and report requirement.
* Identifying new opportunities and driving process and productivity improvements by learning and utilizing the Fortive Business System (FBS).
* Owning and leading your professional and career development: such as stay current on accounting regulation and change in technology and learn the key drivers of the Company’s operations.


**Our Needs:**  

* Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting.
* Minimum 3 years combined public accounting or corporate accounting. operation experience.
* Working knowledge of GAAP or IFRS a plus.
* Operate in a way that never compromises ethics and integrity.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify and support practical solutions.
* Detail-oriented with the objective of consistently delivering high quality work product, while maintaining an understanding of the bigger picture.
* Proficient with MS Office Suite and other analytical tools such as Incorta.
* A forward-thinking mindset with an ability to make connections, carry forward learnings, and identify or anticipate potential challenges before they arise.
* Able to effectively manage and prioritize multiple tasks in a high-energy, dynamic environment.
* Not afraid to push back to leadership through data driven decision making models.


Fortive Corporation Overview
  
  

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.
  
  

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.
  
  

We are a diverse team 18,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.
  
  

**Fortive:** For you, for us, for growth.
  
  

Ready to move your career forward? Find out more at careers.fortive.com . Come join our team at Advanced Sterilization Products (ASP) and be part of a global leader in infection prevention solutions for the healthcare industry. With advanced products, technologies, and workflows for medical sterilization and disinfection, ASP is dedicated to defending the lives of patients, families, healthcare workers, providers, and communities. Add your talent to our extraordinary team and help us in our mission to make healthcare safer for everyone. ASP is based in Irvine, California with core sites in Everett, Washington and Schaffhausen, Switzerland plus many more offices around the world.
  
  

We Are an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
Fortive Corporation and all Fortive Companies are proud to be equal opportunity employers. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or other characteristics protected by law. Fortive and all Fortive Companies are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should ask to speak with a Human Resources representative to request an accommodation.
  
  

**National:** The salary range for this position is $65,900- $122,500
  
  

This position is also eligible for bonus as part of the total compensation package.
  
  

Base pay offered may vary depending on various factors, including, but not limited to: job-related knowledge; skills; experience; and other eligibility factors such as geographic location. The Total Rewards package includes competitive base pay and an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and several programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

title: Sr. Accountant (Remote)
description:
**Position Description**


The Senior Accountant role will report to the Catapult Learning Accounting Manager. The primary responsibility of the Senior Accountant will be to ensure the monthly balance sheet reconciliations are completed accurately and timely to ensure proper reporting of company position to the executive team. The Senior Accountant will work with our Regional Directors and Financial Analysts to ensure that P&L results are reported correctly. The role will be instrumental in support the field in understanding their performance and driving results. Among other things this position will assist with other tasks and audit needs of the company. This is a full-time remote position with limited office meetings in corporate headquarters in Philadelphia (The Navy Yard).

 **Primary Functions and Essential Responsibilities**

* Lead in the month-end close process: preparing journal entries, reconciling accounts, and preparing account analysis.
* Participate and contribute to the areas such as revenue accounting, expense accruals, and leases.
* Prepare Balance Sheet reconciliations including receivables, accruals and prepaid.
* Continue to improve the standardized closing and reporting processes in order to streamline operations.
* Work with Shared Services Accounting team to ensure accuracy of P&L results.
* Support Financial Planning and Analysis team in developing forecasts and budgets for the division.
* Prepare and manage sales & use tax filings and personal property tax filings on the monthly, quarterly and annual basis.
* Assist with consolidated year end audit, along with required state audits.
* Produce ad hoc reports and analyses as requested.
* File state required reporting and documentation.

 **Qualifications**

* BS in Accounting or Finance.
* Minimum 2+ years of relevant accounting and finance experience.
* Experience in a monthly close process.
* Strong Excel skills.
* A hands-on, take-charge financial professional with strong financial and analytical skills.
* High attention to detail and possesses excellent organizational skills
* High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation. Strong business and common sense.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

title: Staff Accountant - Accounts Payable
description:
**SUMMARY**  

The Staff Accountant will successfully process invoices. manage accounts payable using accounting software, establish and maintain relationships with existing and new vendors, ensure bills are paid in a timely and accurate manner, manage staff receipts for credit cards, prepare monthly budget reports for budget owners, review reports with budget owner, support the Snr. Director of Finance in the monthly grant reconciliation process and pick up and process the mail at a P.O. Box in Bowie, MD.  

  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Code and process invoices for payments
* Review and correct budget coding as necessary
* Manage accounts payable using Sage and PN3
* Establish and maintain relationships with new and existing vendors including setting up new vendors in systems
* Ensure all bills are paid in a timely and accurate manner while adhering to departmental procedures
* Process Amex receipts and ensure correct coding
* Prepare monthly budget reports and meet with budget managers to review budgets.
* Support production of 1099’s
* Provide support to the Snr. Director of Finance in the monthly grant reconciliation process
* Produces donor financial reports for grants
* Pick up the mail weekly at P.O. Box in Bowie, MD

  

**ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*** Maintains custody of corporate credit card, including monthly reconciliation
* Sets up and maintains employee accounts for suppliers, including Amazon and Staples
* Assists Controller with chart of account maintenance in PN3
* Support the audit process
* Serves as backup for accounting staff as needed
* Performs general office and related work as required

  

**EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS*** Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting business administration or relevant field.

  

**EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS*** 3 or more years experience in Accounts Payable, with similar responsibilities
* Expertise in Excel and proficiency with MS Office
* Federal Grant and Contract experience
* Demonstrated knowledge of the accounting field.

  

**OTHER SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSES*** Concepts and practices of accounting as applied to the accounting and fiscal reporting operations of non-profit
* Process accounting transactions in accordance with the appropriate accounting concepts and procedures, to maintain accounts.

  

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES*** This position has no supervisory responsibilities/no direct reports.

  

**MANAGES*** 0

  

**TRAVEL, WORK ENVIRONMENT, AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS*** This is a full-time position, working 35 hours per week, Monday-Friday, 9 AM – 5 PM eastern
* The Staff Accountant works from home
* The Staff Accountant position must be able to physically pick up mail from a P.O. Box in Bowie, MD
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear and will require staring at a computer screen and/or documents for extended periods of time
* This position is expected to regularly attend Foundation meetings and trainings.

 **SALARY RANGE**

* $55,000 - $58,000


A virtual screening assessment will be administered during the interview process.

title: Accountant
Accountant (Remote)
description:
**General Description:** 

This position entails professional accounting duties crucial to the functioning of the CEA governmental department, and reporting of taxes, as required by Tribal Compact with the State of Nevada, and Tribal Ordinance 61. The role focuses on maintaining the computerized financial accounting system and ensuring the accuracy of the Department's financial records. Key responsibilities include reconciling the department's accounts, generating monthly financial reports such as Profit & Loss Statement, Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Cash Flow Statement, and Budget Utilization reports.

Additionally, the incumbent will lead the annual financial audit process and collaborate closely with third-party auditing firms. They will also conduct audits of financial records, sales, and tax filings for regulated cannabis establishments within the Department's jurisdiction. A strong grasp of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and government accounting practices is essential to perform these duties effectively.

Must uphold meticulous data management practices to maintain the integrity, traceability, transparency, and accessibility of financial records. Ensuring the accuracy and reliability of all accounting work is imperative to withstand external audits effectively.

**Roles and Responsibilities:** 

* Prepares journal entries and periodic reconciliation of general ledger
* Reviews accounting documents to ensure accuracy of information and calculations and makes correcting entries
* Prepares financial statements and budget utilization reports
* Financial Record Maintenance:
* - Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for the Department
* - Ensures adherence to accounting principles, government regulations, and organizational policies
* Budgeting
* - Monitors budget performance and provides monthly utilization reports.
* Financial Reporting:
* - Prepares timely and accurate financial reports
* - Ensures compliance with government accounting standards and reporting requirements.
* Audit Support:
* - Assists in the preparation for internal and external audits
* - Addresses audit findings and implements corrective actions
* Policy Compliance:
* - Stays informed about changes in government accounting standards and regulations
* - Ensures compliance with relevant financial policies and procedures
* - Maintains up to date knowledge of Nevada Cannabis Tax regulations
* Works with Quickbooks and Excel to maintain accounting records and generate reports
* Assists with other related duties as assigned

**Other Requirements:** 

* *Remote Positions:*Must have a computer with a camera, email, phone, and reliable internet access**.** Must be available Monday-Friday Between 8am-5pm and be able to respond to any communications with 1 business day. Must alert the department ahead of any absences.
* May be required to work outside of normal operating business hours to accommodate meetings.
* Must be a minimum of 21 years of age.
* Must maintain an active business license with the Colony Enterprise Authority.

*Preference is given to qualified members of the Reno-Sparks Indian Colony followed by members of other federally recognized tribes.*

title: Client Accountant
description:
Healthcare Administrative Partners, HAP, is looking for a seasoned accountant with a customer first mentality to work full-time in our remote Financial Client Management team.


Healthcare Administrative Partners is a leading provider of medical billing, coding and consulting for healthcare providers. Our headquarters is located near Philadelphia in Media, PA. Our outsourcing operations are conducted in our Media location as well as in our Portsmouth, NH office. We strive to deliver our services effectively, efficiently, and with the highest level of integrity possible. That's how we've earned our clients' trust for over two decades and continue to earn their business every day. From helping healthcare providers attain their financial objectives to having more time to spend with patients, we're enabling our clients to achieve their goals specifically because of the dedication of our employees.


The Client Accountant is responsible for the oversight of client's financial data and compliance by maintaining accurate books on accounts payable and receivable, payroll and daily financial entries and reconciliations, in addition to monthly financial reporting, general ledger entries and record payments and adjustments.

 **Essential Functions:**

* Oversee financial data for assigned clients, maintaining accurate books on accounts payable and receivable, payroll, and daily financial entries and reconciliations.
* Manage workflow to ensure all accounting transactions are processed accurately and timely.
* Perform daily accounting department operations and data entry processing.
* Reconcile bank statements.
* Administer proper general ledger coding of transactions.
* Process accounts payable and accounts receivable transactions.
* Process payroll and reimbursement transactions.
* Assist with basic human resources duties such as new hiring documents and insurance enrollment.
* Maintain files and documentation thoroughly and accurately, in accordance with company policy and accepted accounting practices.

 **Additional Functions:**

* Prepare filings such as Federal Forms 1099/1096 and tangible property tax reports.
* Reconcile payroll tax filings to general ledger activity.
* Identify and resolve discrepancies.
* Respond to routine client and management inquiries in a timely and professional manner.
* Pass and complete assigned training, including HAP's annual compliance training.

 **Knowledge and Skills:**

* Basic accounting knowledge
* Understanding of industry benchmarks in accounting bet practices
* Expertise in Microsoft Excel
* Establishing accounts
* Developing standards
* Data entry
* Deep understanding of accounting principles
* Attention to Detail
* Confidentiality
* Thoroughness

 **Education and Work Experience:**

  

* High School Diploma or equivalent required; Associate degree in accounting preferred.
* Five or more years of accounting and financial administration experience required.
* Knowledge of physician reimbursement and medical billing in radiology preferred.


If you are passionate about your work, able to manage the inevitable obstacles that come your way, and are willing to go the extra mile to exceed expectations, we're interested in talking to you.

**Benefits:** Competitive pay, Health insurance, Dental insurance, Vision insurance, Retirement plan, Paid time off, Flexible schedule, Philanthropy

description:

title: Staff Accountant
description:
At OneStudyTeam (a Reify Health company), we specialize in speeding up clinical trials and increasing the chance of new therapies being approved with the ultimate goal of improving patient outcomes. Our cloud-based platform, StudyTeam, brings research site workflows online and enables sites, sponsors, and other key stakeholders to work together more effectively. StudyTeam is trusted by the largest global biopharmaceutical companies, used in over 6,000 research sites, and is available in over 100 countries. Join us in our mission to advance clinical research and improve patient care.


**One mission. One team. That's OneStudyTeam.**


By joining our team as our **Staff Accountant**, you will play a key role in day to day general ledger management and full cycle accounts receivable and accounts payable processes.


### **What You'll Be Working On**


* Maintain and update accounting records and files, including vendor and customer management
* Post transactions and categorize records in the general ledger
* Assist with the month-end and year-end close process

* Create and process expense reports in the accounting software

* Support year-end internal and external audit

* 4+ years of accounting experience
* Bachelor's degree in Accounting preferred
* Experience in Netsuite, Bill.com, and Expensify are preferred
* Must be detail-oriented and able to work under pressure to meet deadlines
* Strong interpersonal skills and organizational skills


Learn more about our global benefits offerings on our careers site: https://careers.onestudyteam.com/us-benefits

title: Staff Accountant
description:
**STAFF ACCOUNTANT**

**Supervisor:** Dual Supervision between the Accounting Team Supervisor & Accounting Services Director  
**Position Type:** Full-time, non-exempt  
**Compensation:** $60,000 - $67,000/year  
**Schedule:** Monday - Friday / 8:00AM - 5:00PM (Additional hours may be required)  
**Benefits:** Health insurance, Dental insurance, Vision insurance, Life insurance, 401(k), Flexible schedule, Paid time oﬀ

**\\*A Note to Applicants - Please review this job post in full to ensure you are completing all required steps when submitting your application.\\***

**ABOUT NFP PARTNERS**

NFP Partners is a growing, evolving organization that appreciates innovative, efficient ideas and constructive feedback to better the way we support our clients and our team. We offer our clients the benefits of experienced accounting professionals at a fraction of the in-house cost through our outsourced nonprofit accounting services. These services range from total operation and management of our clients’ finance function to higher-level CFO support.

At the root of NFP Partners are our core values: Build, Unite, Care, Dedication, Knowledge, Communication, and Innovate. These are the standards we live by and operate within, guiding our daily decisions and actions. Knowing the financial positions of nonprofits are always at stake, we must show up every day with honesty and integrity to ensure they are as successful as possible. We do all of this and more while maintaining an intention to *impact the world one accounting challenge at a time.*

Read more about us at .

**ABOUT THE POSITION**

NFP Partners is seeking an organized and efficient Staff Accountant to join our team. This position partners with our Senior Accountants and plays a crucial role within NFPs accounting operations to complete client deliverables as outlined within each scope of work. This individual must use independent judgment to successfully complete all of the assigned responsibilities, including, but not limited to, processing accounts payable and receivable, conducting bank reconciliations, managing client payroll, assisting with grant invoicing, and preparing all applicable tax documentation. They will also be responsible to manage client relationships, maintain clear, proactive communication and continuously explore opportunities to further develop the partnership.

The ideal candidate must be strongly self-managed, team-oriented, and driven to succeed. They are able to toggle multiple client needs and perform all assigned accounting tasks in a fully remote environment. They must also exercise flexibility in their work - acknowledging and effectively navigating multiple tasks and conflicting priorities, as needed. We are looking for someone who enjoys learning tech and teaching systems to others, has a knack for accounting strategies, and values the missions of all non-profit organizations.

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Accounts receivable
* Accounts payable
* Bank reconciliations
* Payroll 1
* Basic balance sheet reconciliation
* Perform basic troubleshooting to reconcile accounts
* Payroll allocations
* Grant invoicing
* Preparation of business financials
* Audit preparation
* 990 preparation
* Vendor management
* 1099s and W9s
* General marketing tasks
* Client relationship management and customer service
* Exercise flexibility with after-hours work to meet client needs
* Additional projects and tasks, as assigned

**SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS**

* At least 5 years of demonstrated accounting experience, required
* At least 2-3 years of proven experience performing accounting in a multi-client environment, preferred
* Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or related experience
* Nonprofit/government accounting experience, preferred
* Must possess all basic and advanced skills and knowledge of accounting functions, as well as how said functions apply to nonprofit organizations (i.e. analyzing financials and provide accurate data to support clients’ financial decision making)
* Advanced experience with Microsoft Office, Windows, and all browsers, as well as experience with a variety of accounting software packages (including Quickbooks, Quickbooks Online, MIP, Bill.com, Intacct)
* Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents
* Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize work in an autonomous, remote environment
* Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Proven ability to successfully work independently and with common sense

**ADDITIONAL DETAILS**

* NFP Partners will provide employees with a laptop and docking station.
* Secure (non-public) internet access is required as all work is completed in a cloud-based environment.
* Competitive benefits package offered - health, dental, vision, and life insurance, 401(k), and unlimited PTO included
* Candidates will not be considered without a cover letter.
* Candidates are also asked to provide a video recording (no more than 3-5 minutes) with their application, answering one or multiple of the following questions: *Tell us about yourself. Why are you interested in working for NFP Partners? What is your ideal work environment? What are your strongest attributes and areas of improvement?*

* Life insurance
* Paid time off

* Work from home

* 5 years

* Monday to Friday

title: Accountant III (Remote)
description:
About Blackhawk Network:

Blackhawk Network (BHN) is the leader in global branded payment technologies. We strengthen relationships between brands and their customers, employees, and partners by transforming transactions into connections. BHN’s portfolio includes: Gift Card & eGift products, promotions and distribution that grow revenue faster; Rewards & Incentives that build loyalty and acquisition and are integrated into today’s leading platforms; and Payments that enable businesses and customers to access and disburse funds in convenient and innovative ways. BHN’s network spans across the globe with over 400,000 consumer touchpoints. Learn more at BHN.com.  

This position may be performed remotely anywhere within the United States except for the State of Alaska, North Dakota, or South Dakota.
Overview:

We are looking for a General Ledger Accountant to be a part of our growing Global Financial Services Center. In this role, you will assist in maintaining and ensuring the integrity of our accounts. The position is responsible for high volume transactional reconciliations, preparing necessary information for financial and/or management reporting and including ad hoc analysis of accounts, trends, and variances. The candidate must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and should be able to build relationships with the Settlement, Corporate accounting, and other cross functional teams. As a key employee of our core General Ledger Accounting team, you will support our growing global business.


Responsibilities:
* Responsible for high volume, complex account reconciliations, identifying areas of risk, developing new processes to mitigate risk, enhancing data accuracy and implementing process solutions
* Responsible for period end duties including accruals and preparing schedules as required to support accurate reporting of financial results
* Responsible for working with internal and external parties to resolve discrepancies and maintain accurate and timely financials
* Drive variance analysis and other ad hoc financial and management reporting as needed
* Work with cross functional teams to build strong understanding of business needs and reach consensus on effective solutions
* Support departmental goals and service levels, cross training, and providing additional coverage as necessary


Qualifications:
* BA/BS in Accounting required, CPA or MBA preferred
* Minimum 5+ years of related Accounting experience
* Experience in all cycles of a financial closing process (revenue recognition, accrual set-up and execution, account reconciliation, etc.) and complete understanding of GAAP reporting requirements, internal controls, and SOX compliance
* Proven experience navigating through complex structure, system, and processes identifying opportunities for automation and/or improvement
* Proficient in Microsoft Office with intermediate to advanced Excel skills
* Demonstrated ability to analyze data, interpolate results from large data sets, identifying trends and drawing conclusions
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, prioritize appropriately and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
* Experience with ERP System, Microsoft Dynamics a plus
* Possess a high degree of initiative, self-motivation, and resourcefulness to meet schedules and deadlines
* Excellent verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills needed to develop collaborative working relationships within GL team and cross functional teams
* Ability to work independently and resourcefully with minimal supervision to take on new tasks with varying levels of difficulty and see them through to completion


Benefits:

Salary Range for all U.S. Residents (excluding Alaska, California, North Dakota, South Dakota): $69,830.00 to $76,000.00  

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, Blackhawk Network offers benefits including 401k with employer match, medical, dental, vision, 12 paid holidays throughout the year, sick pay accrual according to state law, parental leave, life insurance, disability insurance, accident and illness insurance, health and dependent care flexible spending accounts, wellness benefits, and flexible time off for all full-time employees.
EEO Statement:

Blackhawk Network provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Blackhawk Network believes that diversity leads to strength. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.  

Blackhawk Network encourages applicants with previous criminal records to apply to all positions and, pursuant to the San Francisco and Los Angeles Fair Chance Acts (and other “Fair Chance” laws), Blackhawk Network will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. For Philadelphia applicants or jobs, please see a copy of Philadelphia’s ordinance on this topic by clicking this link: https://codelibrary.amlegal.com/codes/philadelphia/latest/philadelphia\\_pa/0-0-0-280104.

title: Junior Accountant
description:
**Job Description:**

The PayOli Solar Junior Accountant will be crucial in the team's financial management and will be capable of maintaining accurate and up-to-date financial records/transactions. They will produce financial statements and other reports for managers, prepare bank deposits, and be responsible for accounts payables and receivables.

**Responsibilities:**

* Use bookkeeping software, spreadsheets, and databases to maintain financial or account records.
* Enter financial transactions into the appropriate computer software
* Execute sales or other financial transactions.
* Receive and record cash, checks, and vouchers
* Verify the accuracy of financial or transactional data.
* Produce reports, such as balance sheets (costs compared with income), income statements, and totals by account
* Reconcile or note and report any differences they find in the records
* Compile data and document transactions.

**Qualifications**:

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
* 1 - 2 years of experience as a Junior Accountant or in a similar role.
* Solid understanding of accounting principles and financial regulations.
* Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero).

title: FIXED ASSET ACCOUNTANT
description:
**We’re looking for a self-motivated Fixed Asset Accountant who has a passion for challenges, innovation, and helping people to achieve their goals.**

**ABOUT INFOSYNC SERVICES**

Multi-unit business operators often find accounting and payroll to be frustrating and expensive. InfoSync provides the people and technology so they can focus on their core business.

With over 11,000 locations using our services across 90 different brands, InfoSync is the leading provider of outsourcing services for multi-unit businesses.

**WHY WORK FOR INFOSYNC?**

At InfoSync, we know that you want to be a valued employee. In order to do that, you need a job with purpose, development, and opportunity for growth. We believe everyone should feel a part of a bigger purpose and enjoy coming to work every day. That is why we’ve hired over 800 employees who help us achieve our mission, vision, and our values.

**Mission:** Be the leading provider of outsourced business solutions through insight and innovative technologies, the development of people, and delivering excellent customer service.

**Vision:** Power people, enabling them to maximize their success.

**Values:** People, Teamwork, Respect, Integrity, Accountability, and Purpose

**ABOUT THE ROLE**

Under the general supervision of the Controller, the Accountant's responsibilities include managing the monthly close for specific clients including posting journal entries, allocations, issuing financial statements and responding to P&L questions, balance sheet reconciliations on a monthly and quarterly basis, maintaining fixed assets and assisting in preparation of audits schedules. Other task and responsibilities assigned by the supervisor

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree or 4 years of related experience
* Strong Fixed asset experience
* Experience with creating and using financial statements, working knowledge of balance sheet and P&L Statement.
* Intermediate to Advance Excel skills, including pivot tables and lookup function
* Ability to multi-task and prioritize assigned projects to meet deadlines
* Ability to communicate effectively with clients, customers and vendors
* Self-motivated; ability to take on assigned tasks with minimal supervision
* Work extra hours as needed

**Preferred:** 

* Bachelors in Accounting

**Responsibilities:**

Client Relationship:

* Secondary contact for day to day activity, questions.
* Participate in weekly client calls with client and controller if applicable.
* Respond to client requests.

Monthly close process:

* Capturing or uploading, validating, posting journal entries.
* Review of repair an maintenance accounts for capital items
* Recording depreciation and preparing supporting documentation
* Prepare and maintain recurring journal entries
* Maintain and update system “Allocation” entries.
* Perform close procedures relating to fixed assets per period close checklist.
* Issue/send preliminary financial statements to client as requested or required.
* Receive and respond to preliminary P&L questions from client.
* Issue/send final financial statements to client. (via Rightview web, email, and/or hardcopy)
* Prepare and issue other reports for client.

Account Reconciliations:

* Reconcile the balances in fixed asset subsidiary ledger to general ledger accounts
* Concentration bank account
* All or most balance sheet accounts on a monthly or quarterly basis.
* Participate in balance sheet reviews with Controller/Client

Other Activities:

* EDI – loading files and validating cross reference tables. (Optional)
* Monthly rental payments – submit change requests to AP
* Maintain fixed asset system, updating for new assets and any other changes.
* Assist in preparation of audit schedules and assist audit and support controller in additional audit requests.
* Approve new vendor setup

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

* 2 years

* Monday to Friday
