title: Accountant II
description:
**Role:**


To support the financial management and operations of Credit Union Service Network, LLC's (CUSN) through the maintenance of accounting reports and reconciliations. This position will also support the accounting function of our client credit unions and other CUSOs. Working on-site at client locations may be necessary from time to time.

***\\*\\*Credit Union Accounting Experience Preferred.***

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**


Perform all essential accounting functions for credit union clients in a timely and accurate manner. These functions include, but are not limited to:

* Upload data files into client's accounting system for daily use (if required).
* Perform daily processing of ACH and Share Draft files for clients.
* Processing of stop payments, adjustments, and origination maintenance may be included.
* Perform daily processing and settlement balancing of various processes as required contractually.
* Balance and verify general ledger accounts daily; prepare and post journal entries as needed.
* Document procedures for assigned tasks and update the procedure library as needed.
* Assist with the month-end close process by preparing and posting month-end journal entries, simple reconciliations and other tasks as needed.
* Maintain client records in a timely and orderly manner in accordance with prescribed standards.
* Maintain proper documentation as appropriate to the nature of the transaction processed.
* Ensure all deadlines are met for client deliverables
* Take ownership of client issues, work with clients and vendors to resolve issues.
* Ability to resolve issues with vendors and clients independently only escalate if needed.


Perform intermediate level accounting functions for credit union clients in a timely and accurate manner. These functions include, but are not limited to:

* Complete complex daily, weekly and/or monthly reconciliations; perform research and follow up on outstanding items.
* Assist with implementation of new clients using established on-boarding tools and procedures. Communicate progress and issues timely.
* Prepare supporting schedules for financial and regulatory reports.
* Prepare routine accruals and month-end worksheets.
* Assist with monthly client status update preparation.
* Assist with audit/examination support.
* Assist with Accountant I training.


Consistently use the portal for work items and ticketing for clients.


Continually look for process improvement opportunities.


Perform a variety of miscellaneous duties including, but not limited to:


* Computer input
* Filing


Other duties as assigned

**Knowledge, Skills and Environment:**

**Experience:**


One to three years of accounting experience desired - financial institution experience preferred. (Bank, Credit Union, Savings & Loan, etc.)

**Education:**

A four-year degree with accounting or related emphasis or completion of a specialized course of study at a business or trade school or job specific skills acquired through on the job training or apprenticeship program.

**Interpersonal Skills:**

* Work normally involves contact with persons beyond immediate associates generally regarding routine matters for purposes of giving or obtaining information which may require some discussion.
* Outside contacts take the form of service to the public (customers or vendors) requiring ordinary courtesy in providing assistance and information.
* Maintain a professional attitude while interacting with internal and client staff

**Other Skills:**

* Able to operate a 10-Key, PC, and applicable software (MS Office, various data processing systems, and various internet-based programs) as well as accounting systems.
* Excellent mathematical skills
* High level of accuracy required
* Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written and/or oral instructions
* Ability to deal with problems involving multiple concrete variables in standardized and/or non-routine situations.
* Understanding of a general ledger, including double sided accounting

**Work Environment:**


Regular exposure to favorable conditions such as those found in a normal office.

title: Staff Accountant
description:
**Position:** Staff Accountant

**Classification:** Full-Time, Exempt

**Reports to:** Director of Finance and Accounting

**Date:**  February 2024

**MISSION:** Futuro Health launched in 2020 to address the critical shortage of workers in the healthcare sector. Our nonprofit mission is to improve the health and wealth of communities by growing the largest network of allied healthcare workers in the nation. Initially funded by a $130 million investment from Kaiser Permanente through a collective bargaining agreement with SEIU-UHW, Futuro Health has since grown to have a portfolio of funders, grants and contracts to do our work that is life changing. Every year, thousands of diverse adults become Futuro Health Scholars and pursue training to earn their credentials for a wide array of in-demand allied healthcare roles. What sets Futuro Health apart is our comprehensive approach to supporting Futuro Health Scholars throughout their education journey and our deep expertise in the healthcare sector. We address the healthcare workforce shortage by personalizing education journeys for diverse adults to enter into allied healthcare careers at low or no-cost. More on Futuro Health can be found at www.FuturoHealth.org.

**OUR VALUES**

- We keep Scholars, communities, and equity at the center of our work.

- We design solutions that are agile, inclusive, and scalable.

- We earn and maintain trust through collaboration and accountability.

- We pave the way with leading-edge practices.

- We use data science to inform continuous improvement.

- We look toward the future and embrace new opportunities.

**Why Should You Join Futuro Health:** Do you seek to change lives for the better? Do you want a role in a nonprofit focused on designing solutions and bringing direct services to make a difference to Scholars, communities and the nation? Have you shown grit when it comes to taking on challenges and pushing forward to resolution?

Our team of talents share a commitment to Futuro Health’s nonprofit mission. We celebrate the opportunity to transform lives through our purpose-driven work. We bring our skillsets, a can-do attitude, and a collaborative approach to our everyday work of forging workforce development models that apply best practices. We know it takes collective effort to design adult-friendly, inclusive, agile, and scalable solutions that meet the big challenges of the day -- ranging from worker shortages, social and economic mobility, to equity in care. If these qualities speak to you, apply to become part of the Futuro Health team.

**Position Summary:**

The Staff Accountant plays a crucial role in ensuring accurate financial records and providing support to the finance department. They are responsible for various accounting tasks, including record keeping, reconciling accounts, preparing financial statements, and assisting in financial analysis. The Staff Accountant works closely with the finance team, ensuring compliance with accounting principles and company policies. *Note: This job description provides a general overview of typical responsibilities and qualifications for a Staff Accountant. Actual job duties and requirements may vary depending on the organization and specific role.* 

**Essential Job Functions**

**1. General Accounting:**

* Perform day-to-day accounting activities, to include recording financial transactions, maintaining general ledgers, and preparing journal entries.
* Reconcile bank accounts, credit card statements, and other financial accounts to ensure accuracy and identify discrepancies.
* Maintain and update fixed asset records, including depreciation calculations and asset tracking.

**2. Financial Reporting:**

* Assist in the preparation of financial statements, including statements of financial position, statements of activity, and cash flow statements.
* Compile and analyze financial data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
* Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for management and regulatory compliance.

**3. Accounts Payable and Receivable:**

* Process vendor invoices, verify accuracy, review and approve coding, ensure timely payments.
* Prepare invoices for funding sources per funder guidelines including providing required documentation.
* Monitor accounts receivable, follow up on outstanding invoices, and maintain good customer relationships.
* Assist in the resolution of billing discrepancies and payment issues.

**4. Bank Reconciliations and Cash Management:**

* Perform monthly bank reconciliations to ensure accurate recording of transactions.
* Monitor cash balances and cash flow projections.
* Assist in managing cash receipts and disbursements.

**5. Financial Analysis:**

* Assist in financial forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis.
* Participate in the preparation of financial models, feasibility studies, and cost-benefit analyses.
* Contribute to the identification of financial trends, risks, and opportunities.

**6. Compliance and Audit:**

* Ensure compliance with company policies, accounting standards, and relevant regulations.
* Assist in internal and external audits, providing necessary documentation and explanations.
* Support the implementation and maintenance of internal controls to safeguard financial assets.

**Qualifications:**

* 3-5 years' experience in accounting or finance roles.
* Experience working in a nonprofit organization with multiple funding sources
* Proficiency in accounting principles and financial analysis.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and calculations.
* Experience with Sage Intacct a plus.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Proficient in using accounting software and Microsoft Office applications.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

**Education:**

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. Knowledge of relevant regulations, such as GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles).

**Work Environment/Travel:**

This is a remote role. Travel will also be required to attend meetings and conferences.

**Supervisory Responsibility:**

This role does not have supervisory responsibility over other staff.

**Physical Demands:** The capacity to lift 25 pounds is required. Able to drive, sit, stand, and walk for long periods of time. Ability to work irregular hours including after hours and weekends although this will be infrequent.

**Position Type:** This position is full-time. The hours may include weekends, nights and holidays.

Futuro Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

* 401(k) 4% Match
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Travel reimbursement
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Staff Accountant

title: Senior Staff Accountant
description:
**About Us:**
Primary is a mom-founded kids clothing brand on a mission to encourage every kid to be the truest version of themselves. Since launching in 2015, Primary offers an assortment of simple, beautiful, gender neutral styles known for their hand-me-downable quality, super soft and sustainable fabrics, and slogan-free designs. Our customers are passionate about our mission, which has led to incredibly strong repeat metrics and one of the highest NPS scores in the industry (85+). We are laser-focused on building a strong, sustainable and profitable (!!) business, and hiring the best people to help us get there.  

Our company values kind and thoughtful self-starters who can think strategically and then work collaboratively with people across the organization to produce high-quality outcomes. We are also a very change-friendly group of people, and are always seeking fresh points of view to uncover ways we can improve our products, processes and team culture. **Full-Time Employee Benefits:*** 4-day workweek: Fridays are flexible at Primary to allow you to manage your work-life balance
* Company-sponsored medical, dental, & insurance, pre-tax spending/savings accounts, 401(k), company-provided disability & life insurance, and more.
* Generous time off: 12 days of PTO (15 days after two years at the company), 3 floating holidays, 11 company-paid holidays (plus the last week of December off), plus 12 weeks of fully paid parental leave for all new parents
* Primary School: a program that gives every employee $100 a month to spend on classes to help them grow (even if unrelated to their work).
* $500 to spend on improving your work from home setup (for remote/hybrid employees)

  

We are seeking a senior staff accountant who will be responsible for assisting with ongoing monthly close, quarterly balance sheet reconciliations, annual financial audit, tax and other related compliance reporting and examinations, as well as managing special projects to up-level and streamline the accounting function. This individual is comfortable working both independently and as part of a team and can thrive in a remote work environment. We are seeking someone with solid experience in accounting who is highly motivated and driven for continuous improvement.
### **What You'll Do:**

* Assist with ongoing monthly close:
* Book month-end journal entries related to the financial close.
* Perform monthly bank reconciliations and prepare supporting schedules including identification and resolution of any variances and/ or reconciling items.
* Reconcile monthly receivables.
* Maintain fixed asset and lease schedules and book corresponding monthly journal entries.
* Perform monthly Balance Sheet flux analysis, identifying key drivers of large fluctuations.
* Work alongside cardholders to review and code corporate purchasing card activity on monthly basis to the general ledger.
* Review and post employee expense reports monthly.
* Perform quarterly balance sheet reconciliations.
* Assist in preparation of monthly management reports and accompanying schedules.
* Assist with annual external audit:
* Assist in managing the communication and timeline with external auditors.
* Preparation of PBC audit request items including preparation and review of corresponding support schedules and work-papers.
* Comprehensive and timely review of auditor selections.
* Assist with various compliance reporting requirements including state sales & use tax matters and annual bank examinations.
* Identify areas for process improvement with the goal of considerably condensing the current close timeline, eliminating manual processes which are prone to human error, increase work-paper transparency and reviewability, and improve internal controls.
* Develop new, and augment existing, documentation of accounting procedures including assisting in developing informal accounting policy memos.
* Work on special projects on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis.

### **What You'll Bring**

* Thorough understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
* Strong analytical, problem solving and accounting skills.
* Experience with major accounting software packages for general ledger accounting (NetSuite preferred but not required).
* Intermediate to advanced experience with MS Excel including manipulating large datasets through pivot tables and other advanced conditional functions.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a deadline driven environment.
* Strong verbal and written communication, time management, and organization skills.
* Strong judgement and ability to set and achieve deadlines.
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team in a remote work environment.
* Capability of tackling recurring workflows with strong level of ownership, minimal up-front guidance, and proactive follow-through.
* Willingness and desire to be challenged and take on new tasks with increasing levels of difficulty.
* Highly detail oriented with an organized approach to workpaper layout, documentation, and ongoing maintenance.

### **Education & Certifications**

* Bachelor of Science in Accounting or equivalent from an accredited university.
* Minimum of three to five years of experience in the accounting industry, with Big 4 accounting experience preferred.
* CPA, or working towards CPA.


The starting salary for this role will ultimately be determined by the level of the candidate hired. All our employees also receive generous equity packages in addition to our full suite of benefits and perks.
Want to apply but not sure if you’d be the right fit? If this role calls to you, we want to hear from you. There is no ‘perfect’ candidate. Everyone brings something different to the team, and our diversity is what makes us strong. Speaking of which - not only is discrimination illegal, it is simply not tolerated at Primary. We welcome all candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States for any employer to apply.  

  

If you have any accommodation needs for your interview, please let us know at hr at primary dot com. We are happy to make reasonable accommodations at any point during your time with Primary.  

Primary Privacy Policy

title: Part-Time Staff Accountant/HR Admin
description:
**Company Description:**


SquareWorks Consulting is a NetSuite partner focused on elevating its customers' experiences with exceptional automation solutions and consulting services. Our products include Automate, a NetSuite-native financial automation platform that enhances and takes NetSuite to the next level. We believe in building long term partnerships with customers to enable their success, and that starts with our team. We strive to enable our employees to achieve professional excellence by providing training and development resources, a diverse and inclusive workplace, a fully remote working environment, a healthy work/life balance, as well as other wellness benefits and programs. By embracing this mentality, we can put our best foot forward every day to help our customers succeed.

title: Controller//Fully Remote
description:
Meeting Tomorrow is a 20-year-old company with a growing team of 85 friendly employees. We’re headquartered in Chicago, with 80% percent of our team working remotely in cities all over the country. We produce in-person, hybrid, and virtual events and rent equipment that brings people together. Our clients range from Fortune 500 companies to small businesses, and we pride ourselves on providing the best customer experience in the events industry. We offer the greatest coworkers you’ll find anywhere, great benefits, and the opportunity to work in a dynamic, team-oriented, entrepreneurial environment. We can’t wait to meet you! **The opportunity:**
Meeting Tomorrow is an event production and technology company that has been producing events for over 20 years. We have thousands of clients that work with us when they need to have their events go well.  

The Controller is responsible for leading the Accounting function at Meeting Tomorrow. This role is responsible for establishing and maintaining the overall accounting systems, procedures, and policies for Meeting Tomorrow, LLC and associated business entities. This role serves as the head of the Accounting function and is responsible for creating a department plan and defining and managing work inside the team. This work includes areas such as analysis and reporting of financial information including budgets, producing and submitting required filings and reports, and producing and maintaining all supporting financial statements in accordance with GAAP.  

This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, financial reporting and managing and reporting on budget and forecast activities. They will also have a heavy hand in doing the work as well. In addition to internal responsibilities this role is responsible for maintaining relationships with third party vendors such as our accountancy partner, insurance brokers, and financial institutions.  

Meeting Tomorrow is a growing company and in addition to the above this role is responsible for contributing to and managing strategic initiatives and identifying and implementing improvements to ensure we are well positioned for the future. **The Team**
This role is responsible for managing a team of employees including three Senior Accountants and a Staff Accountant to ensure that work is properly allocated and completed in a timely and accurate manner, and that proper accounting practices are in place and being followed. This role reports to the CEO but works closely with a number of stakeholders including our senior leadership team.  

The Controller will be responsible for:* Leading the Accounting operations within the organization. Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes.
* Partnering with internal stakeholders to ensure they receive the support and information they need from the Accounting team.
* Providing management with information vital to the decision-making process. Develops a deep understanding of the business, defines and monitors business performance metrics, and makes recommendations on where we should focus our efforts.
* Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results.
* Coordinating and preparing internal and external financial statements.
* Ensuring required and appropriate accounting processes and internal control systems are in place. This includes overseeing regulatory reporting, tax planning, and compliance.

 **Who you are:*** **Accounting Expert.** You have your CPA and have led the accounting function as a whole.
* **Leader.** Communicates confidently with teams and has high emotional intelligence.
* **Self-directed.** Can take the lead and execute plans with little to no guidance.
* **Great communicator.** Proven ability to adapt communication style to different audiences; can communicate at a high level while also providing necessary supported facts and data.
* **Adaptable.** You're adaptable to the changing needs of the company.
* **Sound judgment.** Thinks clearly; weighs facts, assumptions and potential consequences to make decisions that positively impact the team and company as a whole.

  


### **The impact you’ll make: Within 1 month, you’ll:**

* Familiarize yourself with the company culture, policies, and procedures.
* Meet with key stakeholders, including executives, department heads, and team members.
* Understand Meeting Tomorrow’s past and current projects.
* Schedule one-on-one meetings with team members to understand their roles and perspectives.
* Attend team meetings and company events to connect with colleagues.
* Familiarize yourself with Meeting Tomorrow’s Accounting systems, processes, and routine activities. Meet with and shadow team members to understand how their work connects to the whole.

### **Within 3 months:**

* Take full ownership for Meeting Tomorrow’s Accounting systems, processes, and routine activities.
* Complete an initial review and identify areas for improvement within the Accounting team and how the team interacts with other teams.
* Define team priorities in partnership with your manager, internal stakeholders and the accounting team.
* Take full ownership for team management including 1:1s, coaching conversations, and developmental planning.

### **Within 6 months:**

* Create a department plan for the remainder of the year.
* Lead the mid-year re-forecast process in partnership with your manager and internal stakeholders.
* Independently deliver on the different aspects of your job description through your own efforts and the efforts of your team.


The above range is the starting salary range for this role. The final starting salary is based on individual experience and how closely it translates to the role. Once in the role, we offer annual merit increases based on performance.
At Meeting Tomorrow, our mission is to foster a culture of respect and affection. We embrace our differences and are committed to having a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment. We’re an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes in second chances and strongly encourage BIPOC, women, LGBTQIA, veterans, persons with disabilities, formerly incarcerated and all other individuals to apply. **Our benefits include:** full medical coverage (health, vision, dental, short term disability and life insurance), PTO and 9 paid holidays, annual profit-sharing bonus, 100% charitable giving match, employer match 401k with subsidized brokerage fees, gym membership reimbursement, employee-led social action teams, fully paid parental leave, paid bereavement leave and fun social gatherings!  

What makes Meeting Tomorrow’s culture so special is the people, and we look for candidates who are a match for our company’s core values: **commitment, kindness and humility.** If those words describe you and you see yourself in this posting, you’re ready to apply!

title: Staff Accountant
description:
Protecht is reinventing refunds, aiming to make every purchase refundable. Our core strength lies in our proprietary Software-as-a-Service embedded refund protection platform, delivering massive distribution and a best-in-class digital purchase experience for insurance carriers, event, booking, & ticketing platforms, and consumers.


Role Overview:


Protecht seeks a Staff Accountant to assist the Controller in day-to-day accounting & finance tasks. This includes a full cycle accounting close, accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll processing & working with other departments within the company to implement new procedures.


The ideal candidate is fiercely determined, fanatical about our mission, is a good human, and has a winning mentality.


Responsibilities:

* Daily recording of transactions.
* Assist in the financial month end close process.
* Processing Accounts Receivable invoices & ensuring payment is collected.
* Processing Accounts Payable bills & processing payments.
* Working with our technology team to implement a new transaction ledger.
* Reconciliation of new transaction ledger.
* Reconciliation of cash receipts to Protecht’s core system.
* Payroll processing.
* Assist with chargeback processing.
* Other projects as directed by the Controller or CFO.


Requirements:

* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting.
* 2+ years of professional accountant experience.
* Experience assisting with end-of-month processes.
* Experience invoicing external parties.
* Experience making ACH & Wire payments through banking portals.
* Data entry.
* Proficient computer skills and experience using:
	+ Microsoft Office (Word, Excel)
	+ NetSuite accounting software.
	+ Payment processing sites: Stripe, Braintree, CyberSource, WorldPay, etc.
	+ Bank & treasury management systems: Wells Fargo & Wells Fargo Commercial Electronic Office.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional and friendly demeanor. Ability to communicate with other departments.
* This is a remote position - travel to Protecht HQ in Phoenix, AZ, and team meetings are required as necessary.


What We Offer:

* Fully Remote Working Environment
* Competitive Salary and Equity Opportunities
* Unlimited Paid Time-off
* Full Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
* Annual Bonus Program
* 401k Matching
* $100/month for Event Ticket Purchase
* Company Sponsored Events

title: Financial Reporting Accountant
description:
Under general direction, performs various complex analytical and technical accounting functions to gather, analyze, interpret, record and present financial data and reports, according to established Accounting practices and established company procedures. In addition, supports clients as well as internal Client Services and Information Technology staff regarding Client Accounting reports.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
* Maintains confidentiality of CDS Global and its clients’ proprietary information.
* Develops, prepares, and analyzes various formal financial statements, reports and records. Researches and prepares various routine to complex accounting and reconciliations up to and including journal entries.
* Provides research, analysis, and resolution with Month End balancing variances, questions, and issues from the Client Accounting Specialists as needed for all Order Management Systems. Then provides resolution and functional guidance, verbal and written, to Client Accounting Specialists.
* Completes the necessary steps for conversions and transfers reconciliation as it pertains to Client Accounting (per the Workplan).
* Provides explanation and overview of Client Accounting reporting package to both current and perspective clients for all Order Management Systems.
* Provides training, assistance, and knowledge of financial reports from our Order Management Systems to the clients as well as internal contacts, e.g., Client Management, Client Support staff and Information Technology staff.
* Assists with revising and designing financial reports as needed.
* Creates new Query and balancing efforts as required to support the Month End balancing process (for Client Accounting Specialists), often due to changes in the system or business policies.
* As needed or required, reviews new programming releases and/or database fixes to ensure the financial impact is known and represented in the Journal Entry.
* Provide assistance and guidance regarding Payment Systems setup as needed for various internal departments.
* Works on special projects as requested by the Manager.
* Organizes tasks and resources to complete work and meet deadlines according to established departmental procedures.
* Learns and applies new information in fast paced environment, including various systems, databases and/or system generated reports.
* Interacts in cooperative, positive, and professional manner with all levels of employees, clients and/or vendors in team-oriented environment.
* Makes decisions on variety of tasks frequently requiring discretion, judgment and initiative guided by general procedures or standards.
* Follows all CDS Global ergonomic and safety policies.

ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
* Works extended hours as required or requested.
* Performs additional duties as required or requested.

EDUCATION AND/OR CERTIFICATION, SKILLS AND LICENSING
* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field, or equivalent Accounting work experience.
* Five or more years of business accounting experience.
* Proficient PC spreadsheet, word-processing and database knowledge and skills. Microsoft Office or equivalent software products, e.g., Excel, Access, and Word preferred.
* Proficient verbal and written communication skills.
* Demonstrated skills gathering and interpreting data to solve non-routine and complex problems.
* Demonstrated experience working in a team environment.
* Demonstrated skills prioritizing and completing long/short-term tasks with minimal supervision.
* Advanced math skills.
* Demonstrated experience remaining productive in changing environment.
* If required to travel, has access to transportation requiring a valid driver’s license, proof of safe driving record and active insurance.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
SIG doesn't just provide consulting services; we solve problems. We are a team of dedicated professionals deeply committed to excellence and innovation. For over 35 years, we have been a trusted partner to more than 700 colleges and universities worldwide, offering comprehensive strategy, implementation, and managed support.


**Why SIG?**



At SIG, we don't just follow the industry standards; we set them. Our approach is rooted in our core values: **Client Centricity**, clients are at the heart of everything we do; **Trust, Honesty & Integrity**, we always do the right thing, even if it's not easy; **Higher Education Experience**, with SIG you know you are always working with seasoned professionals, and each new team member is surrounded by peers who bring knowledge and wisdom to the table; **Diversity, Inclusion & Respect**, fostering an inclusive environment for all; and **Team Investment & Collaboration**, we believe in investing in our team's growth and thriving through collaborative efforts, achieving shared success.

**About the role**:



We are seeking a qualified, motivated individual to join our company as a Senior Accountant. As part of our team, you will be responsible for assisting with the monthly financial statement close, overseeing the established integration of our billing and accounting systems, assisting with our external audit, and remitting our income and sales taxes. Our preferred candidate has four to five years of accounting experience, preferably including the use of the NetSuite and NetSuite OpenAir software. This experience should include: preparing financial statement reconciliations and documentation under a monthly deadline, audit preparation work or actual audit experience, a strong understanding of revenue recognition principles, and a proven record of maintaining tax compliance. This is a **remote opportunity** within the US.


**Responsibilities:**


* Generate understandable financial account reconciliations monthly.
* Meet deadlines on the financial statement close.
* Ensure proper revenue recognition on customer projects with a variety of billing methodologies.
* Assist with the preparation of documentation for the annual external audit and ensure proper internal controls are followed.
* File and remit monthly sales taxes for the few states that require service-based sales taxes.
* Report on debt covenants monthly.
* Produce managerial reports surrounding budget-to-actual, work-in-process, scheduling, and backlog reporting.
* Ensure the connection between NetSuite OpenAir and the NetSuite General Ledger synchronizes for proper revenue recognition, accounts receivable, deferred revenue, and work-in-progress.
* Communicate effectively and coordinate with other teams to solve any discovered issues.


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* 4-5 years working on financial statements and analysis.
* Proficient with Microsoft Excel.
* Either experience auditing or providing support on an external audit.
* Proven experience in meeting financial close deadlines with clear and repeatable documentation covering the reconciliation of financial accounts.
* Solid understanding of ASC 606 and other generally accepted accounting principles.
* A high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Experience with NetSuite and NetSuite Open Air preferred
* Experience with the Professional Services Industry


**Compensation & Benefits:**



Our compensation package consists of salary, annual bonus, and retirement benefits.


* Flexible hours and ability to work from home
* The salary range for this position is **$85K-$100K** depending on skills and experience
* A selection of medical, vision, and dental
* Flexible spending account
* 3 weeks of PTO, 40 hours of sick pay and holiday pay
* Life insurance
* **5% contribution** to your 401(k) retirement
* Professional Development opportunities
* Connectivity stipend of $75 per month

 *The listed salary range for this position is indicative and subject to adjustment based on the candidate's unique skills and location. Final compensation will be determined through mutual agreement between the successful candidate and SIG.*



SIG is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Accountant
description:
**Job Title: Accountant**

***Job Summary:***

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Accountant to join our team. The Accountant will play a critical role in managing various accounting functions, including financial reporting, accounts payable and receivable, reconciliations, and budgeting. The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in accounting principles and regulations, with proven experience in accounting roles.

***Responsibilities:***

* **Financial Reporting**: Prepare and analyze accurate financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements. Ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulations.
* **Accounts Payable and Receivable**: Oversee the accounts payable and receivable processes, including invoice processing, vendor payments, customer invoicing, and collections. Maintain accurate records and reconcile accounts as necessary.
* **General Ledger Maintenance:** Manage the general ledger and chart of accounts. Record journal entries, accruals, and adjustments. Perform month-end and year-end closing procedures with precision.
* **Reconciliations:** Conduct bank reconciliations and reconcile accounts payable and receivable balances. Investigate and resolve discrepancies promptly to ensure data integrity.
* **Budgeting and Forecasting**: Assist in developing annual budgets and periodic forecasts. Monitor budget variances and provide insightful analysis to support decision-making.
* **Tax Compliance**: Support the preparation and filing of various tax returns, including sales tax, payroll tax, and income tax. Stay updated on changes in tax laws and regulations.
* **Financial Analysis**: Perform thorough financial analysis to identify trends, variances, and key performance indicators. Provide actionable insights to management for strategic planning.
* **Internal Controls**: Ensure compliance with internal control procedures and recommend enhancements where necessary. Collaborate with auditors and provide documentation and support during audits.
* **Process Improvement**: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains in accounting processes. Implement best practices to streamline workflows and enhance productivity.

***Qualifications:***

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.

CPA certification or progress towards CPA eligibility preferred.

Minimum of 2 years of experience in accounting roles, with a strong emphasis on financial reporting, reconciliations, and analysis.

Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, Oracle) and advanced MS Excel skills.

Thorough understanding of accounting principles and regulations (GAAP).

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in work.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Salary: $45,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

* Employee discount

* Work from home

* 1 year
* Under 1 year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities
* Overtime pay
* Performance bonus
* Yearly bonus

Experience:

* GAAP: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* CPA (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: NetSuite Accountant I- III
description:
**InfoAge Solutions, Inc. (IAS)** is a full-service Information Technology Company with offices in Virginia, Maryland, and Washington DC with over 20 years' experience specializing in using technology to help government and businesses achieve success. IAS focuses in Security Management, Infrastructure Hosting, and Business Process Management. IAS' Business Technology Program offers an All-Inclusive Technology Program designed to help smaller organizations professionally enhance their operations by providing a virtual CIO and technology infrastructure. IAS has provided enterprise IT management expertise for the Department of Homeland Security, Oracle Corporation, Deloitte & Touché, State of Maryland, and many other public and private organizations building over 1700 systems for every type of business need. We have the experience to help our clients meet their business goals by combining 'Best Practices' with 'proven technology' to deliver real solutions.


Founded in 2001, IAS is a leading IT, Security Management, Business Consulting firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the resources, expertise, and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients. This is a great opportunity to join a winning team.

**Position Description**
========================


Minimum 4+ years' experience as an Accountant professional. Minimum 4+ years' experience using NetSuite Core Accounting. Management and analysis of income, expenditure accounts, bank statements and bookkeeping ledgers. Generating the company's financial reports using income and expenditure data. Keeping a check on the company's finances based on financial status. Filing and remitting taxes and other financial obligations. Assist with month-end closing schedules, journal entries, and year-end close. Supporting the external and internal audit process. Responsible for month end closing including journal entries, reconciliation, variance analyses, and reporting with finance support to business managers. Assist with completion of annual financial statements and statutory accounts. Assisting in the preparation of the forecast and budget. Support external audits, ad hoc projects, and other duties as assigned. Financial, management, and statutory reporting including preparation and analysis. Project set up and maintain fixed assets registers. Settle small and large complex problems and in doing so, strengthen the relationship with the client. Preparation of deliverables for AU, EUR & US reporting, management reporting and financial analysis. Recognize when alternative perspectives are required and facilitate appropriate meetings. Interact with other departments in the company daily with best practices, processes, and procedures for the optimal financial and operating performance of the company. Participate in the continued implementation and process improvements with NetSuite. Process credit card payments from customers, apply to accounts and deposit daily. Prepare and manage payment application and deposit of checks daily. Post accounts payable daily and prepare accounts payable for payments weekly. Review accounts receivable daily. Send statements to customers biweekly. Follow up with customers via email and phone regarding past due balances on alternate weeks. Prepare and manage and process credit memos and refunds to customers as requested. Process recurring transactions and auto pay payments as scheduled. Participate in driving continuous improvement, maintaining an orderly accounting filing system, and automation of financial processes. Self-starter and strong collaborative team player in developing and maintaining strong internal working relationships to promote coordinated financial management practices across the organization. Excel/spreadsheet knowledge experience, including importing and exporting data, formatting reports, pivot tables, tables, and functions. Strong problem-solving skills and detail oriented.

**Requirements**
----------------

* Bachelor's Degree in Accounting.
* CA/CPA qualification.
* Experience with accounting software and data entry.
* Excellent understanding of accounting rules and procedures including the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFS), and Boundary and Annexation Survey (BAS).
* Advanced knowledge and experience of spreadsheets.
* Ability to work independently.
* Analytical skills.
* Committed to continuous improvement.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Proactive in resolving issues.
* Ability to work to deadlines and to work successfully in a team.

**Optional**

* Manufacture Accounting

title: Junior Accountant
description:
Movable Ink scales content personalization for marketers through data-activated content generation and AI decisioning. The world's most innovative brands rely on Movable Ink to maximize revenue, simplify workflow and boost marketing agility. Headquartered in New York City with close to 600 employees, Movable Ink serves its global client base with operations throughout North America, Central America, Europe, Australia, and Japan.

The Junior Accountant will primarily support the Accounts Receivable Manager with daily cash application, customer billing, and customer collections. In addition, the accountant will assist with tasks across all of accounting as needed. This role provides the opportunity for someone to learn about multiple areas of accounting and Movable Ink's business.


**Responsibilities:**


* Own daily cash application of customer receipts
* Assist with invoicing and collections
* Engage with past due clients via phone and/or email and achieve payment resolution
* Communicate delinquent account status to accounting team weekly
* Record journal entries within the company's ERP
* Perform reconciliations for balance sheet accounts including Accounts Receivable
* Assist with the month-end, quarter-end, and year-end close processes
* Assist with audit requests
* Support the accounting team with special projects, ad-hoc reporting and analysis requests, and other tasks as assigned


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Accounting and/or prior proven accounting experience
* Experience with a fast-paced, growing company is a plus
* Prior experience with NetSuite is a plus
* Proficient in Excel
* Strong communication skills


The base pay range for this position is $65,000-$75,000/year, which can include additional on-target commission pay/bonus. The base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Stock options and other incentive pay may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, depending on the position ultimately offered.


Studies have shown that women, communities of color, and historically underrepresented people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture where all Inkers can thrive. If you're excited about the role but don't meet all of the abovementioned qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Our differences bring a breadth of knowledge and perspectives that makes us collectively stronger.



We welcome and employ people regardless of race, color, gender identity or expression, religion, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ethnicity, family or marital status, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, disability, Veteran status, or other protected characteristics. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Accountant
description:
**About Indigo**

Indigo Global Development Inc. is an American corporation that acts as the coordinating lead company for the world-wide activities of the Indigo Group, which includes affiliated companies in the Caribbean, Europe, the United States, and Africa. The Indigo Group serves public and corporate needs in emerging market countries, primarily in the areas of petrochemical supply, materials supply, and management services for infrastructure projects in the agriculture, water, sanitation, and energy sectors

**Position Summary** 

We are a growing and looking for an accountant to join our team. We consider this an important and essential role as the candidate will be interacting with colleagues, clients, and vendors.

The Accountant will provide support to the CFO and work closely with members of the senior staff and operations personnel. The duties will cover a mix of financial accounting, management reporting and project work.

The position is full time with work from home flexibility, and for the right candidate it can be 100% remote.

The candidate must be located in US Eastern or US Central Standard time zone.

**Responsibilities:**

* Accounts Payable/Expense Forms duties such as: processing vendor invoices, subcontractor invoices and employee expense forms, posting invoices and expense forms in the accounting system, and retain supporting documentation.
* Assist in special projects and other tasks as assigned as well as performing other finance department functions as needed.
* Invoicing/Accounts Receivable duties such as: preparing draft trial billings and finalizing trial billings for invoicing; preparing prime as well as other invoices as directed; recording invoices in the Accounts Receivables Journal of the accounting system; recording necessary revenue adjustments; and preparing cash deposits and recording cash.
* Manage intercompany transactions and reconciliations with affiliates.
* Liaise with payroll outsourcing partner to process payroll cycles with assurance of accuracy and record fiscal activity into general ledger.
* Book Closing duties such as: creating and posting end of month entries; reconciling balance sheet and income statement accounts; ensuring compliance with all company, local, state, and federal accounting and financial regulations.
* Other Support Functions such as: maintaining accounting files; running monthly accounting reports; monitoring cash balance, preparing cash flow analysis, and recommending use of line of credit when necessary; preparing schedules and analysis for outside accountants' review.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Resource Economics, or other related degrees.
* CPA is a plus.
* Thorough knowledge of general ledger accounting and account reconciliation.
* Understand federal, state, and local tax, tax withholdings and taxation of employer paid benefits as well as usage of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles in United States (GAAP).
* Experience with accounting software, preferably QuickBooks Enterprise.
* Intermediate to advanced skills and knowledge of Excel, Word, and other Microsoft 365 applications.
* Excellent interpersonal skills to communicate effectively across the organization.
* Self-motivated, organized, and detail-driven.
* Ethical behavior and attention to detail.
* Flexibility, professional demeanor, ability to respond calmly and positively to rapidly changing situations.
* Flexibility of hours to interact with colleagues in different time zones.
* Working proficiency in French is desirable, but not essential.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* accounting: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Cost Accountant
description:
Join Our Team: Cost Accountant Needed for Oil & Gas Specialists

Are you a seasoned Cost Accountant with a passion for the intricate workings of the Oil & Gas industry? Do you thrive in setting up robust accounting systems that drive efficiency and accuracy? If so, we want YOU to be part of our dynamic team at Upwards Tax Consultancy!

Position: Cost Accountant  
Industry: Oil & Gas  
Location: Any  
Experience Level: Mid-Senior Level  
Employment Type: Remotely - Contract

**Visa Status: Own residence visa / Required** 

About Us:  
At Upwards Tax Consultancy, we specialize in providing top-tier financial solutions to businesses navigating the complex landscapes of taxation. With a commitment to excellence and a focus on delivering unparalleled value to our clients, we pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative environment where innovation thrives.

* **Role Overview:**
* As a Cost Accountant specializing in Oil & Gas, you will play a pivotal role in our clients' success by establishing and maintaining cutting-edge accounting practices tailored to their unique needs. Your expertise will be instrumental in ensuring accurate cost analysis, budgeting, and financial forecasting within the dynamic realm of the Oil & Gas sector. Moreover, your proficiency in QuickBooks will enable seamless integration and optimization of financial processes, driving operational efficiency and enhancing decision-making capabilities.

Key Responsibilities:

* Conduct detailed cost analysis to identify key cost drivers and areas for optimization within Oil & Gas operations.
* Develop and maintain cost accounting systems and methodologies tailored to the unique requirements of the industry.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant data and insights for accurate cost allocation and reporting.
* Monitor and analyze variances between budgeted and actual costs, providing actionable recommendations to enhance profitability.
* Prepare timely and accurate cost reports, forecasts, and financial statements to support strategic decision-making.
* Implement cost control measures and process improvements to drive operational efficiency and cost savings.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, regulations, and best practices to ensure compliance and maximize value for clients.
* Utilize QuickBooks and other accounting software to streamline processes and ensure data integrity.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or CMA certification preferred.
* Has a private residence visa in UAE
* Minimum of [3 years] of experience in cost accounting, with a focus on the Oil & Gas sector.
* Proficiency in QuickBooks and other accounting software.
* Strong analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, with a proven track record of building lasting client relationships.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while managing multiple priorities effectively.

Join Us:  
If you're ready to take your career to new heights and make a significant impact in the Oil & Gas industry, we want to hear from you! Apply now to become part of our team and embark on an exciting journey of professional growth and success.

* https://www.linkedin.com/company/upwards-taxconsultancy/

Upwards Tax Consultancy is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and experiences.

Job Type: Contract

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* Do you have own residence Visa?

Experience:

* Accounting: 3 years (Required)
* Cost accounting: 3 years (Required)
* QuickBooks: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Remote (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Connexus Credit Union - Who We Are:
Serving members across all 50 states, Connexus Credit Union is a member-focused cooperative that is proud to return profits to member-owners through high yields for checking accounts and deposit products, as well as competitive rates for personal, home, and auto loans. From its early beginnings on through the years, Connexus has remained a strong, growing, and secure financial institution that remains committed to serving the financial needs of our member-owners across the country.
Connexus offers an Amazing Benefits package:* 25 days of paid time off and 7 paid holidays
* 16 hours of paid Volunteer Time Off
* 401K Retirement with up to 6% employer match
* Excellent Health, Dental, Vision insurance, including multiple plan options
* Health Savings Account with generous employer contributions
* Employer paid Life insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Tuition Reimbursement from $4,000 - $7,000 per calendar year
* Robust Learning and Development program that includes an annual professional development stipend

  

Connexus has a Values-Based Culture:
Our Values of Integrity, Respect, Transparency, Wellbeing and Synergy aren't just words on a page; our values dictate the actions of the organization and everyone within it. We demonstrate our values in every personal interaction, phone call, and email ‐ every day.
Responsibilities:* Provide technical support to Staff Accountants and/or Accountants in team, to promote skill development, accuracy, and effectiveness. Plan, assign, and review work within team.
* Assist with projects and implementation of new initiatives, collaborating with project team and department.
* Prepare daily and month end reconciliations for assigned general ledger accounts, ensuring entries are posted and appropriate documentation is completed in a timely manner.
* Manage daily reconciliation for cash accounts and ensure adequate cash levels are maintained based on expected activity. Assist with cash flow projections and liquidity reporting for the credit union.
* Assist with the preparation of the quarterly NCUA 5300 Call Report, tax reporting, and other regulatory reports.
* Support third party partnerships by providing timely reporting and effectively responding to requests and questions.
* Provide back up support to Accounting Manager.

* Fourth Largest Credit Union in Wisconsin (by asset size)

title: Part-Time Nonprofit Accountant
description:
Job description

Halpert CPAs is looking for a part-time, work-from-home Accountant to serve their non-profit client base. This position will be based out of your home office working between 10-30 hours per week. This position offers PTO and a retirement plan with employer match.

As an Accountant, you will support a number of non-profit organizations remotely, by doing their monthly accounting and reviewing the bookkeeping done by their in-house staff. You will prepare finance reports for review by staff, board, and other stakeholders. Members of the firm provide vacation coverage for colleagues when needed and are involved in the continual improvement of the firm's systems.

Our ideal candidate has experience with balance sheet account reconciliations and financial statement preparation. This candidate will be able to consistently produce high quality finance reports but also know when to ask for help. Halpert CPAs seeks an Accountant with the confidence and humility to be a supportive teacher and an eager student.

Essential Responsibilities:

Monthly Accounting

* Performs bank and credit card account reconciliations
* Reviews and adjusts balance sheet accounts to supporting schedules, including prepaid expenses, vacation time, and fixed assets
* Allocates shared costs to functions (program, administration, and fundraising) for the statement of functional expenses
* Tracks expenses for grants received and adjusts temporarily restricted net asset balances
* Reviews transaction detail, noting coding changes and using them as opportunities to train the client
* Produces a set of monthly finance reports for staff and board
* Checks 990 returns and audited financial statements to client records

Guidance and Support

* Responds to client questions in a timely manner using the most effective mode of communication for the situation
* Trains clients in the proper use of QuickBooks Online (QBO) and the best practices developed by our firm

Other Duties

* Implements improvements proactively to client and our firm’s systems when relevant
* Reports hours worked accurately and on a daily basis
* Responds to colleague and supervisor questions and requests in a timely manner
* Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

* Proficiency with QuickBooks, Excel, web-based cloud tools, and Google Drive Apps
* Basic knowledge of GAAP required; familiarity with non-profit GAAP preferred
* Experience with monthly close accounting tasks
* Experience working with supporting schedules (fixed assets, prepaid expenses, etc.)
* Ability to analyze financial statements
* Experience in accounting at a small- or mid-sized non-profit organization preferred
* Experience teaching QuickBooks bookkeeping to non-accountants preferred
* Ability to be patient and flexible in dealing with clients and colleagues at different comfort levels with accounting
* Professional manner in all communication
* Co-operative and balanced approach to work

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Must be able to communicate via phone and email
* Must be able to work at a computer for extended periods of time
* Ability to travel locally is preferred

Please submit a resume AND cover letter as one document. Note applications without a cover letter will not be considered. We are interested in why this position is a good fit for you.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $34.00 - $35.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Paid time off
* Work from home

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Staff Accountant
description:
Tebra only initiates contact with candidates via email from an official Tebra email address (@tebra.com, @patientpop.com, or @kareo.com) or through our applicant tracking system, Greenhouse. We will only ask you to provide sensitive personal information through our official application portal — not via social media or text message. We do not conduct interviews via instant messaging.



About the Role
===============



We are looking for a highly motivated Accountant with a positive attitude, analytical mind and excellent interpersonal skills to support our ever-evolving business. The Staff Accountant will be an integral member of the Accounting team, supporting Tebra's Finance & Accounting operations in a fast-paced, team-focused environment that provides many challenging opportunities in the development of one's professional, technical, and analytical skills. Quick studies possessing the ability to understand and apply more complex areas of accounting and a drive to enhance our processes are essential for success in the role.



Your Area of Focus
===================


* Responsible for daily transaction processing, coding and recording including employee expense reports, vendor invoices and bank cash coding
* Responsible for maintaining, reconciling, and analyzing the general ledger account activity in accordance with United States generally accepted accounting principles and company accounting policies.
* Assist in month-end close activities: recording recurring and non-recurring journal entries; closing & reconciling sub-ledgers (e.g., AP, Fix Assets etc..); and preparing balance sheet reconciliations
* Contribute to monthly & quarterly fluctuation analysis
* Ensure financial records are maintained in compliance with company policies and procedures in an accurate and timely manner
* Provide exceptional service cross-functionally across the organization by answering queries from employees, vendors and other external parties accurately, timely and professionally
* Assist with U.S. local, state, and federal tax filing, including preparation and filing of annual 1099s, property taxes, etc.
* Identify opportunities and propose solutions that can lead to more efficient and effective procedures
* Assist with other areas of accounting and complete special projects as needed
* Participate in cross training of other roles and responsibilities across the accounting team

Your Professional Qualifications
================================


* Bachelor's degree (B.S/B.A.) in Accounting or Finance
* 2-3 years experience in corporate accounting
* Experience performing month-end close procedures and preparing deliverables
* Independent self-starter who is detail oriented and able to identify potential solutions to problems, and work collaboratively with peers and managers to accomplish objectives
* Confident, self-motivated, and diligent with strong organizational skills to be able to prioritize and execute many assignments in a quick and efficient manner
* Excellent written and verbal communication including the ability to effectively document procedures performed and analysis of results
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well within a team
* Intermediate to advanced Excel proficiency required; NetSuite experience preferred

About Tebra
===========



Kareo and PatientPop have joined forces to become Tebra, the digital backbone for practice well-being. While our teams are still supporting both products, our new hires and current employees are now united as Team Tebra.



Tebra aims to unlock better healthcare by helping independent practices bring modernized care to patients everywhere. Well over 100,000 providers trust Tebra to elevate their patient experience, and help them grow their practice. At Tebra, we're building the future of well-being together. That shared vision for tomorrow begins with compassion and humanity today.



Our Values
===========


Start with the Customer
-----------------------



We get to know our customers - and their patients - and look at the world through their lens.



Keep It Simple
---------------



Healthcare is too complex. We aim to simplify it for everyone.



Stay Entrepreneurial
---------------------



We reject the status quo and solve problems with creativity, perseverance, and a bias to action.



Better Together
----------------



We are diverse, humble, and collaborative. We put the team first and win together.



Celebrate Success
------------------



Life is short and joy is underrated. We take time to have fun and celebrate success.



Perks & Benefits
=================



In addition to our healthcare benefits, we also offer amazing perks! Need work from home basics? We offer a discount through Dell! We also offer a number of resources to help you keep your mind and body healthy. Check out obe Fitness or Gympass for a great workout, or LifeWorks Employee Assistance Program to find mental health resources, along with other resources for everyday occurrences.

  


**#LI-SS1 #BI-Remote #LI-Remote**

**Remote Pay Range**


$50,000—$60,000 USD*Tebra is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.*


*California residents who apply or are recruited for a job with us: please carefully review our California-specific Privacy Notice under the California Consumer Protection Act here:* *https://www.tebra.com/privacy-policy/california-supplemental-notice/*



If you would like to report a fraudulent Tebra job posting, please contact us at talentacquisition@tebra.com and consider reporting your experience to the FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center or the Better Business Bureau to help keep others safe online, too.

title: Accountant
description:
**Summary**

Working under the direction of the CBO, the Accountant will support the organization maintain a strong financial standing and will facilitate all day-to-day accounting operational functions. The individual entrusted with this role will have a strong focus on keeping accurate data, completing tasks in a timely manner, and will be responsible for providing various financial management reports to the officers and owners of the company. This individual will be entrusted to maintain confidential financial information, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, and evaluate accounting and internal control systems.

**Essential Functions**

* Manage all accounting transactions and functions.
* Manage daily cash and prepare cash-flow reports, projecting cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals.
* Process accounts payable and cash disbursement functions, including weekly check runs.
* Oversee maintenance of accounts payable files and records and act as primary liaison to vendors.
* Oversee payroll reconciliation for contractors and staff.
* Generate and distribute customer invoices.
* Record monthly revenue.
* Prepare financial statements.
* Reconcile accounts payable and receivable as needed.
* Manage and reconcile balance sheets and profit/loss statements.
* Prepare and manage departmental and organizational budgets by establishing schedules; collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data; and preparing budget forecasts.
* Facilitate and complete monthly, quarterly and annual close procedures.
* Monitor and confirm financial condition by conducting audits and providing monthly, quarterly and annual financial reports and metrics to officers and owners.
* Ensure that financial reports comply with the Generally Accepted Accounting Principle.
* Support business administration including insurance, legal compliance, and client support.
* Comply with all local, state and federal laws regarding finances and reporting.
* Ensure compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements.
* Serve as liaison to contracting tax accounting firm.
* Perform other tasks as assigned.

**Skills**

* Excellent knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures, including the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
* Strong competency in financial reporting, with an educational tone to help improve organizational understanding of financial matters.
* Proficiency and hands-on experience with Quickbooks Online.
* Advanced MS Excel skills including Vlookups and pivot tables.
* Experience with ADP Workforce Now.
* Proficiency in general ledger functions.
* Understanding of taxation, payroll, state and federal reporting requirements and other fiscal aspects of a business.
* Ability to prioritize, organize, and manage multiple functions simultaneously while meeting business critical deadlines.
* Ability to achieve goals and align interests through cooperation and collaboration with other departments and teams, even where no direct reporting relationship exists.
* Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment and maintain confidentiality when dealing with sensitive financial matters.
* Excellent organizational and analytical skills, and strong attention to detail.
* Excellent writing, editing, presentation, and communication skills.

**Attributes**

* Ability to work effectively and efficiently within a cohesive team environment to meet the goals and objectives of the organization.
* Willingness to be open and transparent with financial information, while providing critical context and understanding to stakeholders across the organization.
* High level of integrity, loyalty, and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results orientation.
* Maintain open communication and be available and approachable to the team.

**Work Environment**

* This is a remote position with a company-issued computer and phone.
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or business administration.
* 3-5+ years of experience as an accountant within a small to midsize company or division of a large corporation.
* US GAAP experience.
* Excellent technology, analytics and management experience required.

**Affirmative Action/EEO statement** 

North American Training Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested applicants should submit an application and resume via our website: https://northamericantrainingsolutions.com/joinnats/

Please direct all inquiries to Karen Hauck: karen@natstraining.com

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $24.00 - $28.00 per hour

Expected hours: 25 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Work from home

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Staff Accountant
description:
We're looking for a talented Staff Accountant to join our Business Acceleration team. The staff accountant will post day-to-day vendor invoices and sales deposits into the Dealer Management Software; as well as reconcile accounts to ensure accuracy. This position requires consistent organizational and communication skills, all while working in a fast-paced, high-volume environment. Responsibilities include maintain daily worksheets and general ledger system, maintain and complete files and records as needed, assist with accounts payable and receivable duties, and provide general administrative support to controller and accounting department team.

What you'll be doing:

* Reconcile and record day-to-day financial transactions and complete the posting process
* Verify transactions are recorded accurately and in the correct ledger
* Perform partial checks of the posting process
* Complete tax forms and file tax reports such as sales and use tax, 1099 reporting, and other required reporting as necessary for all companies
* Enter data, maintain records and time reports and financial statements
* Reconcile daily closing reports and account for discrepancies
* Reconcile multiple bank accounts and ledger accounts
* Process accounts receivable/payable
* Assist with process implementation and training
* Receive vendor invoices and packing slips, enter in Dealer Management Software, and prepare for payment
* Follow-up on outstanding accounting matters with persons at multiple operating locations

* Direct or participate in special accounting projects as assigned (e.g., on-site Fixed Asset verification)
* Assist in compliance with local, state, and federal laws

Additional Responsibilities

* Flexibility and adaptability for additional responsibilities as assigned

* Solid understanding of basic bookkeeping and accounting principles
* High degree of accuracy, consistency, and attention to detail
* Ability to multi-task, manage a workload, and meet deadlines
* Ability to communicate effectively in an online environment
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Power Point, Excel). Experience in Oracle, PowerBI and Dealer Management Software is a plus

title: Senior Accountant
description:
**IronClad Consulting Services**, a fractional accounting and financial advisory service provider, is looking for a **Senior Accountant** to add to the team. Founded with a passion for people, IronClad focuses on transparency and an exceptional work environment for our team. We specialize in CFO, Controller, and Accounting support for companies ranging from startups to venture backed across the US. IronClad works with all industries including but not limited to Consumer Goods, Food & Beverage, Consumer Products, E-commerce, Technology, Non-Profit, Business Services, Medical Device, & Healthcare. If you are a self-starter, hands on multi-tasker and possess the ability to work independently, come join us!

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist with preparation of monthly reconciliation & reporting of companies’ financial statements
* Work within the client's inventory system from an accounting standpoint to ensure accurate financial reporting
* Process Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Payroll, Sales Tax, and Inventory Transactions with a high level of accuracy and autonomy
* Maintain financials on an accrual basis with a high level of understanding and the ability to identify areas of concern
* Maintain omnichannel sales environments, reporting, and systems
* Learn new softwares based on the accounting and financial environment our client's have
* 1099/W9 management across multiple clients
* Organizational and Time Management across clients to set priorities and meet deadlines
* Effective communication with internal and external teams to meet 24-hr SLA

**Education, Experience, and Skills:**

* Minimum 3 years of professional Full Cycle Accounting experience
* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting (required)
* Advanced experience with QuickBooks Online and Excel required, NetSuite experience (preferred)
* Excellent communications skills - written, verbal and interpersonal - and an ability to tailor communication style to diverse audiences, including executives and operators
* In depth understanding of wholesale, distribution, and direct to consumer environments
* Proven Inventory Experience, inventory software experience a plus
* E-Commerce Experience Required (Shopify, Amazon, other like Woo Commerce a plus, etc)
* Ability to learn and adapt to different systems and clients
* Detail oriented with high degree of accuracy
* Self-Starter and ability to work independently or part of a team

This is a remote position for full-time employment. We have an exceptional team and our highest priorities are our employees and clients!

*At IronClad Consulting Services we recognize, respect and value the contributions of each employee, and we strive to cultivate a work environment that strikes a balance between our professional and personal lives. Our core values guide us to seek out a broad range of perspectives, talent, and backgrounds to achieve our mission; one where all staff contribute to and share our success. We are committed to diversity, and as an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to employment practices that ensure that employees and applicants for employment are provided with equal opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other*
